praecipue: <entryFree id="n37416" type="main" key="praeci^pu^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecĭpŭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. praecipuus <sense id="n37416.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praecipuus: <entryFree id="n37417" type="main" key="praeci^pu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecĭpŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>praecipio</etym>, <sense id="n37417.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is taken before other things</hi> (cf. princeps): excipuum quod excipitur, ut praecipuum, quod ante capitur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=80" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 80</bibl> Müll.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n37417.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Particular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peculiar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">especial</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. communis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 3, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 15, 2</bibl>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non praecipuam, sed parem cum ceteris fortunae conditionem subire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37417.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in jurid. lang., <hi rend="ital">that is received beforehand</hi> (esp. as an inheritance), <hi rend="ital">special</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipua dos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:4:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 4, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peculium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:5:23" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 40, 5, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 3, 6</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praecĭpŭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that which is received from an inheritance before the general distribution of the property</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sestertium quingenties cum praecipuum inter legatarios habuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37417.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, like eximius, <hi rend="ital">special</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">principal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extraordinary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic homo'st hominum omnium praecipuos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: opera praecipua, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:19:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 19, 58</bibl></cit>: quos praecipuo semper honore Caesar habuit, Caes. B. G. <cb n="PRAE" /> 5, 52: <cit><quote lang="la">natura ingenerat praecipuum quendam amorem in eos, qui procreati sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cicero praecipuus in eloquentiā vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipuus scientiā rei militaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir praecipuus corpore viribusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 48, 49, § 154</bibl></cit>: mox praecipuus cui secreta imperatorum inniterentur (<hi rend="ital">the first</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 30</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quibus praecipuos attingemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:89" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponendus inter praecipuos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 116</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophorum Platonem esse praecipuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:81" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipui amicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 56 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remedia calculo humano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 49, 109, § 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba dentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 13, 107, § 170</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">herba ad serpentium ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 27, 41, § 97</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praecĭpŭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">excellence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superiority</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homini praecipui a naturā nihil datum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:33:110" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 33, 110</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praecĭpŭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n37417.4" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">matters of special importance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo statim praecipua ex imperatoriā mente monstravit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principum diversam esse sortem, quibus praecipua rerum ad famam dirigenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 40</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n37417.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Points of superiority</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of excellence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurigarum equorumque praecipua vel delicta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37417.6" n="III" level="1"> Esp., in the philos. lang. of the Stoics, <hi rend="ital">principal</hi> or <hi rend="ital">considerable things</hi>, <hi rend="ital">things that come next to absolute good</hi>, the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">prohgme/na</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:16:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 16, 52</bibl> (v. the passage in connection).— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praecĭpŭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">chiefly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">principally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eminently</hi> (class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inprimis, maxime, potissimum, praesertim),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipue de consularibus disputare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:29:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 29, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipue florere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper Aeduorum civitati praecipue indulserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationem praestat praecipue analogia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipue quidem apud Ciceronem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortasse ubique, in narratione tamen praecipue,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inferioribus praecipueque adulescentulis parcere decet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipue sanus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos praecipue fugiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:59" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivendum recte est cum propter plurima, tum his praecipue causis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 119</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37417.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, = praesertim, <hi rend="ital">especially</hi>, <hi rend="ital">particularly</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">sed perlectus liber utique ex integro resumendus, praecipueque oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostendunt admirabilem praecipue in aetate illā recti generis voluntatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pantheres, leones non attingunt perunctos eo, praecipue si et alium fuerit incoctum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 25, § 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:107" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 4, 34, § 107</bibl>.—So with <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedulitas stulte urget, Praecipue cum se numeris commendat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 261</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:85" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 10, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praecise: <entryFree id="n37418" type="main" key="praeci_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecīsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. praecido, <sense id="n37418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praecisio: <entryFree id="n37419" type="main" key="praeci_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecīsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praecido</etym>. <sense id="n37419.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A cutting off</hi> (post - Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">genitalium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 106, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37419.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., <hi rend="ital">the piece cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cutting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tignorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37419.2" n="II" level="1"> In rhetoric, <hi rend="ital">a breaking off abruptly</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)posiw/phsis</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 30, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37419.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An overreaching</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">finis praecisionis tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:51:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 51, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecisum: <entryFree id="n37420" type="main" key="praeci_sum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecīsum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. <itype>praecido</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
praecisura: <entryFree id="n37421" type="main" key="praeci_su_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecīsūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praecido</etym>, <sense id="n37421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cutting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paring</hi> (post - class.): <cit><quote lang="la">asparagorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Colon. p. 102" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Colon. p. 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:126" default="NO">126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:140" default="NO">140</bibl> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
praecisus: <entryFree id="n37422" type="main" key="praeci_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from praecido.</entryFree>
praeclamitator: <entryFree id="n37423" type="gloss" key="praecla_mi^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeclāmĭtātor</orth>, v. praecia.</entryFree>
praeclamo: <entryFree id="n37424" type="main" key="praecla_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-clāmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n37424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to call out beforehand</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:8:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 8, 7</bibl> (al. proclamaverit): <cit><quote lang="la">proclamat, praeclamat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 93</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeclare: <entryFree id="n37425" type="main" key="praecla_re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeclārē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. praeclarus <sense id="n37425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> A.</sense></entryFree>
praeclareo: <entryFree id="n37426" type="main" key="praecla_re^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-clārĕo</orth>, <itype>ui, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n37426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shine forth</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> Avit. ad Soror. 6, 508</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeclaritas: <entryFree id="n37427" type="main" key="praecla_ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeclārĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praeclarus</etym>, <sense id="n37427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">excellence</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 8, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeclariter: <entryFree id="n37428" type="main" key="praecla_ri^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeclārĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. praeclarus <sense id="n37428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>
praeclarus: <entryFree id="n37429" type="main" key="praecla_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-clārus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very bright.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37429.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">lux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1032" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1032</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iaspis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:42" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37429.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">very beautiful</hi> (physically or morally), <hi rend="ital">magnificent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remarkable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1033" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1033</bibl></cit>: urbs situ <cb n="PRAE" /> praeclaro ad aspectum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:52:section=117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 52, § 117</bibl>: aries praeclarior, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:22:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 22, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo praeclarā virtute et formā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclaris operibus laetari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclara indoles ad dicendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:29:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 29, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus dicendi magnificum atque praeclarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 21, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eximia et praeclara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:20:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 20, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclara et magnifica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi praeclari in philosophiā et nobiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens bello praeclara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 480</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 347</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quicquam est praeclarius aut praestantius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclarissimum facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Tim. 1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Tim. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclarum est popularem me esse in populi salute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,059:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> ad Brut. 1, 3, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <trans><tr>distinguished wealth</tr>, <tr>opulence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 46</bibl></cit>.— Of medicines that operate well, <hi rend="ital">excellent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">efficacious</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">rubrica in medicinā res praeclara habetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 14, § 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:61" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 7, 26, § 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:31" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 4, 14, § 31</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 3, 36, § 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 24, 51, § 110</bibl></cit>.—Ironically: <cit><quote lang="la">illa praeclara tua patientia famis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 10, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclaram populo Romano refers gratiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11, 28</bibl></cit>.—In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">noted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notorious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleribus suis ferox atque praeclarus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37429.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">T. Livius, eloquentiae ac fidei praeclarus in primis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 34</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, in two forms, praeclare and praeclariter. </sense><sense id="n37429.4" n="A" level="2"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">praeclārē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n37429.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Very clearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very plainly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclare aliquid explicare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 9, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclare intellego,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclare memini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclare et apposite et facete scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:23:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 23, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37429.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Excellently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">admirably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very well</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclare nobiscum actum iri, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:4:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 4, § 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnino praeclare te habes, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 61</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">149: simulacrum praeclare factum e marmore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 44</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">96: praeclare facitis, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclare dicere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gerere negotium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:10:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 10, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclarissime aliquid facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:35:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 35, 96</bibl></cit>.—Of medicines that operate well, <hi rend="ital">excellently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">efficaciously</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">radix caeliacis praeclare facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 19, 22, § 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:161" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 15, 90, § 161</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:78" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 4, 25, § 78</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">32, 4, 14, § 35.—As an expression of assent: pacem vult M. Lepidus: praeclare, si, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>very good</tr>, <tr>very well</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:4:8 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 4, 8 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n37429.7" n="B" level="2"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-clārĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">excellently</hi>: rebus praeclariter gestis, Quadrig. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 516, 12</bibl>; Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1010</bibl> P. (<bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> p. 180</bibl> Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
praeclavium: <entryFree id="n37430" type="main" key="praecla_vi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeclāvĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>prae-clavus</etym>, <sense id="n37430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the part of the dress before the purple stripe</hi>, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 64, 22 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
praecludo: <entryFree id="n37431" type="main" key="praeclu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-clūdo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>claudo</etym>, to shut in front, hence, in gen., <sense id="n37431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shut to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to close</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n37431.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">portas praeclusit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecludere portas consuli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 4</bibl></cit> (5), 21: <cit><quote lang="la">portus classi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via lapidum ruinā praeclusa,</quote> <trans><tr>blocked up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, with a personal object: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclusit cunctos negotiatores,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>closed their shops</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37431.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37431.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To close</hi> a thing to any one, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to forbid access to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem orbem terrarum civibus Romanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:65:section=168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 65, § 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritimos cursus praecludebat hiemis magnitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:40:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 40, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi curiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:17:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 17, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes sibi aditus misericordiae judicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:8:section=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 8, § 21</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n37431.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To shut up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impede</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">effugium alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:973" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 973</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 13, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">linguam cani, ne latret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 22, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeclueo: <entryFree id="n37432" type="main" key="praeclu^e^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-clŭĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n37432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be very famous</hi> or <hi rend="ital">renowned</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui in vetustā praecluent comoediā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1518,001:page=2433" default="NO"><author>Ter. Maur.</author> p. 2433</bibl></cit> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">praecluens potestas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 4, 37</bibl></cit>.—In the collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">praeclŭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <hi rend="ital">v. n.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos, qui ex ubertate terrae praecluatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1:38" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1, 38</bibl></cit> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
praecluis: <entryFree id="n37433" type="main" key="praeclu^is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeclŭis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>prae-cluo, clueo</etym>, <sense id="n37433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very celebrated</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">liberi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, § 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conventus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, § 906</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecluo: <entryFree id="n37434" type="main" key="praeclu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeclŭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. praeclueo.</entryFree>
praeclusio: <entryFree id="n37435" type="main" key="praeclu_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeclūsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praecludo</etym>, <sense id="n37435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shuting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">damming up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a reservoir</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 9 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
praeclusor: <entryFree id="n37436" type="main" key="praeclu_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeclūsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that shuts up;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">a hinderer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precluder</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">legis,</quote> <trans><tr>who impedes an understanding of the law</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
praeclusus: <entryFree id="n37437" type="main" key="praeclu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeclūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. praecludo. <pb n="1415" /> <cb n="PRAE" /></entryFree>
praeco: <entryFree id="n37438" type="main" key="praeco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeco</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype> (old <sense id="n37438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dat</hi>, PRAECONEI, Inscr. Lat. 202, 2, 34), <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a crier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">herald</hi>, in a court of justice, in popular assemblies, at auctions, at public spectacles, games, or processions, etc.: exsurge, praeco, fac populo audientiam, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 11</bibl> (Trag. v. 32 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:30:section=76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 30, § 76</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6</bibl>, §§ <cit><quote lang="la">86 and 87 Müll.: haec per praeconem vendidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:34:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 34, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eopse astas lapide, ut praeco praedicat,</quote> <trans><tr>on the auctioneer's block</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut praeco, ad merces turbam qui cogit emendas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 419</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:439" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 439</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:95" default="NO">8, 95</bibl>: indictivum funus, ad quod per praeconem evocabantur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=106" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 106</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n37438.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a publisher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">herald</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">o fortunate adulescens, qui tuae virtutis Homerum praeconem inveneris!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 10, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecoctus: <entryFree id="n37439" type="main" key="praecoctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecoctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praecoquo.</entryFree>
praecoepi: <entryFree id="n37440" type="hapax" key="praecoepi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-coepi</orth>, <itype>pisse</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37440.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to begin before</hi>: urbem, Auct. Itin. Alex. M. 84 Mai.</sense></entryFree>
praecogitatio: <entryFree id="n37441" type="main" key="praeco_gi^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecōgĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praecogito</etym>, <sense id="n37441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thinking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">considering beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forethought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precogitation</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">praecogitationem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecogito: <entryFree id="n37442" type="main" key="praeco_gi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-cōgĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to think upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ponder</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">consider beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to premeditate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precogitate</hi> (perh. not anteAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">plura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abscessum, Cod. Th. 8, 4, 20: multo ante praecogitatum facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecogitati mali mollis ictus venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 76:34" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 76, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolite praecogitare quid loquamini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 13, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecognitio: <entryFree id="n37443" type="main" key="praecogni^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecognĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praecognosco</etym>, <sense id="n37443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">foreknowledge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precognition</hi> (late Lat.), Boëth. Consol. Phil. 5, 4; Ambros. de Fide, 3, 10, 64.</sense></entryFree>
praecognitor: <entryFree id="n37444" type="main" key="praecogni^to^r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecognĭtŏr</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who knows beforehand</hi>, Ambros. de Fide, 2, prol. 14.</sense></entryFree>
praecognosco: <entryFree id="n37445" type="main" key="praecognosco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-cognosco</orth>, no <sense id="n37445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>gnĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to foreknow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foresee</hi> (very rare): praecognito nostro adventu, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 15, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors praecognita est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:97" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Christus praecognitus ante mundi constitutionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Pet. 1, 20: haec enim praecognita, Boëth. Consol. Phil. 5, 4.</sense></entryFree>
praecolo: <entryFree id="n37446" type="main" key="praeco^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-cŏlo</orth>, no <sense id="n37446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>cultum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n37446.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To cultivate beforehand</hi>, trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">animi habitus, ad virtutem quasi praeculti et praeparati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 23, 80</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37446.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">esteem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revere beforehand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nova et ancipitia (i. e. ante tempus opportunum colere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 22</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praecŭltus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to I.), <hi rend="ital">highly ornamented</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">tunc donis sacro praeculta auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:298" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 298</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus eloquentiae praecultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecommodo: <entryFree id="n37447" type="main" key="praecommo^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-commŏdo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to advance as a loan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to give as a favor</hi> (post-class.): quingentos solidos, Cod. Th. 14, 27, 2: linguam, Coripp. Laud. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praecommoveo: <entryFree id="n37448" type="hapax" key="praecommo^ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-commŏvĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to move greatly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 302" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 302</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecompositus: <entryFree id="n37449" type="main" key="praecompo^si^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-compŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [compono], <sense id="n37449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">composed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prepared beforehand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecomposito ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:674" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 674</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeconcinnatus: <entryFree id="n37450" type="main" key="praeconcinna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-concinnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [concinno], <sense id="n37450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">arranged</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prepared beforehand</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">praeconcinnato mendacio fallens maritum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 170, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecondio: <entryFree id="n37451" type="main" key="praecondi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-condĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to season beforehand</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">leporem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:8" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 8, 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
praeconditus: <entryFree id="n37452" type="main" key="praecondi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-condĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n37452.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Part</hi> [condo], <hi rend="ital">prearranged</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">praeconditis causis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Gen. ad Lit. 6:28" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Gen. ad Lit. 6, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeconialis: <entryFree id="n37453" type="main" key="praeco_ni^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecōnĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>praeconnius</etym>, <sense id="n37453.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be praised</hi> or <hi rend="ital">commended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that which ought to be honored</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pietati vestrae praeconiale est diligere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praecōnĭālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">honorably</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeconiatio: <entryFree id="n37454" type="main" key="praeco_ni^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecōnĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praeconium</etym>, <sense id="n37454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">high commendation</hi> (late Lat.), Interpr. Iren. 3, 3.</sense></entryFree>
praeconinus: <entryFree id="n37455" type="main" key="Praeco_ni_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Praecōnīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>praeco</etym>, <sense id="n37455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 7, § 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeconium: <entryFree id="n37456" type="main" key="praeco_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecōnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. praeconius, II.</entryFree>
praeconius: <entryFree id="n37457" type="main" key="praeco_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>praeco</etym>, <sense id="n37457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a</hi> praeco or <hi rend="ital">public crier</hi>: quaestus, <hi rend="ital">the office</hi> or <hi rend="ital">business of a public crier</hi>, <cb n="PRAE" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 31, 95</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37457.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praecō-nĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n37457.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The office of a public crier</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to be a public crier</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeconium me ut detis,</quote> <trans><tr>make me your auctioneer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37457.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37457.4" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a crying out in public; a proclaiming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spreading abroad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">publishing</hi> (syn. praedicatio): <cit><quote lang="la">tibi praeconium deferam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 12, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 176, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeconio contendere,</quote> <trans><tr>in strength of voice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domesticum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:20:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 20, 86</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeconia famae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 207</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peragere praeconia casūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:1:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37457.5" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a publishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laudation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commendation</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">laudatio, elogium): praeconium alicui tribuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandare versibus laborum praeconium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formae praeconia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 12, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeconium facere de Deo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 14, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeconor: <entryFree id="n37458" type="main" key="praeco_nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecōnor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n37458.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [praeco], <hi rend="ital">to perform the office of public crier</hi> or <hi rend="ital">herald</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to herald</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proclaim; to praise</hi> (post-class.), Interpr. Iren. 5: <cit><quote lang="la">fama praeconans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> in Psa. 92</bibl> and 97.</sense></entryFree>
praeconspicabilis: <entryFree id="n37459" type="main" key="praeconspi^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-conspĭcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>conspicor</etym>, <sense id="n37459.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very remarkable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wonderful</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 96, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeconsumo: <entryFree id="n37460" type="main" key="praeconsu_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-consūmo</orth>, no <sense id="n37460.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>sumptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to waste</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spend beforehand</hi> (Ovid.): <cit><quote lang="la">suas vires bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:489" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 489</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:6:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 6, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praecontrecto: <entryFree id="n37461" type="hapax" key="praecontrecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-con-trecto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>tracto</etym>, <sense id="n37461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to feel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">handle beforehand</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in thought</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecontrectare videndo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:478" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 478</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecoque: <entryFree id="n37462" type="main" key="praeco^que_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecŏquē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">praecŏquis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. praecox.</entryFree>
praecoquo: <entryFree id="n37463" type="main" key="praeco^quo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-cŏquo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n37463.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To boil beforehand</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 29, 69, § 288</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rutam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:34:136" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 34, 136</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:3:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 4, 3, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37463.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To ripen fully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecocta uva (sole),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 9, 11, § 81</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecoquus: <entryFree id="n37464" type="main" key="praeco^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecŏquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. praecox.</entryFree>
praecordia: <entryFree id="n37465" type="main" key="praecordi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecordĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype> (<number>sing.</number> praecordium, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 10, 102</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>prae - cor</etym>. <sense id="n37465.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the muscle which separates the heart and lungs from the abdomen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the midriff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diaphragm</hi>: exta homini ab inferiore viscerum parte separantur membrana, quae praecordia appellant, quia cordi praetenditur, quod Graeci appellaverunt <foreign lang="greek">fre/nas</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 77, § 197</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Plato) cupiditatem subter praecordia locavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:10:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 10, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unius praecordia pressit senis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>stopped his breath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:621" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 621</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37465.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37465.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The entrails</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the stomach</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">viscera, exta, ilia): praecordia vocamus uno nomine exta in homine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 5, 14, § 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse anulus in praecordiis piscis inventus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:30:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 30, 92</bibl></cit>: totis praecordiis stertens, M. Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:123" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 7, 19, § 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid veneni saevit in praecordiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:3:5" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulso proluere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 4, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37465.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The breast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the heart</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">spiritu remanente in praecordiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigidus coit in praecordia sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 452</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 140</bibl>.—As the seat of the feelings and passions: <cit><quote lang="la">quondam etiam victis redit in praecordia virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 367</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meis inaestuat praecordiis Libera bilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:15" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verax aperit praecordia Liber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 4, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inquieta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 5, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagrantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:102" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 102</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tacita sudant praecordia culpa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:167" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutare praecordia, i. e. sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:3:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 3, 13</bibl></cit> (2, 4, 31): <cit><quote lang="la">in praecordiis meis de mane vigilabo ad te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 26, 9</bibl></cit>.—Hence, even, praecordia mentis, <hi rend="ital">the seat of the mind</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">the mind</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 149</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n37465.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bodies</hi> in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">in terrā ponunt praecordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:559" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 559</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecorrumpo: <entryFree id="n37466" type="main" key="praecorrumpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-corrumpo</orth>, no <sense id="n37466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ruptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to corrupt</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bribe beforehand</hi> (Ovid.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem donis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa praecorrupta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:295" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 295</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecox: <entryFree id="n37467" type="main" key="praecox"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecox</orth>, <itype>cŏcis</itype>, also <orth extent="full" lang="la">praecŏquis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">praecŏquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>praecoquo</etym>, <sense id="n37467.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ripe before its time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">early ripe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rareripe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">premature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precocious</hi> (syn. praematurus). </sense><sense id="n37467.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">allium praecox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 34, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 4, 10, § 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">germinationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 2, 2, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites praecoquis fructus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex unā praecoque vite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvas praecoquas legere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <trans><tr>bearing fruit before their time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 27, 50, § 114</bibl></cit>: quando jam praecoquae uvae vesci possunt, <hi rend="ital">when the</hi> <cb n="PRAE" /> <hi rend="ital">earliest grapes are ripe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:13:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 13, 21</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n37467.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: loca, and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-cŏcĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">places where fruits ripen early</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 11, 16, § 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:197" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 24, 54, § 197</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n37467.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">over-hasty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">premature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precocious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untimely</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post - Aug. prose; not in Cic.): pugna, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 150, 16</bibl> (Ann. v. 282): <cit><quote lang="la">ingeniorum velut praecox genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">risus praecox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7</bibl></cit> prooem. 1, § <cit><quote lang="la">2: audacia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of a boy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 6</bibl></cit>: fuga, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 150, 17</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 157, 3</bibl>: praecoquis libido, Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 150, 18</bibl>; Afran. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:11:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 11, 9</bibl>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praecŏquē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">prematurely</hi>, etc.: properans, Auct. Itin. Alex. 38 Mai.</sense></entryFree>
praecrassus: <entryFree id="n37468" type="main" key="praecrassus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-crassus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37468.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very thick</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cortex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 8, 13, § 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecrepo: <entryFree id="n37469" type="main" key="praecre^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecrĕpo</orth>, <itype>crĕpŭi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n37469.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sound</hi> or <hi rend="ital">resound beforehand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in domo patris praecrepuisse symphoniam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118, 11, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecrudesco: <entryFree id="n37470" type="gloss" key="praecru_desco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-crūdesco</orth>, <itype>crūdui, 3</itype>, <sense id="n37470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow very hard</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeculco: <entryFree id="n37471" type="main" key="praeculco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-culco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>calco</etym>, <sense id="n37471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to impress strongly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beforehand</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Monog. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praecultus: <entryFree id="n37472" type="main" key="praecultus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecultus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from praecolo.</entryFree>
praecupidus: <entryFree id="n37473" type="hapax" key="praecu^pi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-cŭpĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37473.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very desirous</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fond of</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">pretiosae supellectilis praecupidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:70" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 70</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecuro: <entryFree id="n37474" type="main" key="praecu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-cūro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to care for beforehand</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:37" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res suas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
praecurrentia: <entryFree id="n37475" type="main" key="praecurrenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecurrentĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. praecurro <sense id="n37475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praecurro: <entryFree id="n37476" type="main" key="praecurro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-curro</orth>, <itype>cŭcurri</itype> (curri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:30:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 30, 13</bibl> Weissenb.), <itype>cursum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n37476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to run before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hasten on before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precede</hi> (class.; cf.: antecedo, antevenio). </sense><sense id="n37476.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37476.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">eā ego huc praecucurri gratiā, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propere praecucurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecucurrit index ad Persea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecurrunt equites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecurrit ante omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 34, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citius Petro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 20, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37476.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to go on before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precede; to surpass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo fama jam praecucurrerat de proelio Dyrrhachino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut certis rebus certa signa praecurrerent,</quote> <trans><tr>precede</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:52:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 52, 118</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 12, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui studio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 9, 19</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:61:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 61, 230</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37476.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37476.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to hasten before</hi> a person or thing, <hi rend="ital">to precede</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anticipate</hi>: illud praecurrere cogor, <hi rend="ital">to combat in advance</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:371" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 371</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem aetate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:52:176" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 52, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita praecurrit amicitia judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 17, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec appetitus rationem praecurrant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 29, 102</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37476.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to surpass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excel</hi> in any quality: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 7:28" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem nobilitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem judicio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 22</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praecurrentĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> In rhetoric like antecedentia, <hi rend="ital">things that go before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">antecedents</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:39:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 39, 166</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">primordia rerum et quasi praecurrentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praecursus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">having preceded</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumore praecurso,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecursator: <entryFree id="n37477" type="main" key="praecursa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecursātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>praecurro</etym>, <sense id="n37477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an advanced guard</hi> (post-class. for praecursor): <cit><quote lang="la">revocatis praecursatoribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 12, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecursio: <entryFree id="n37478" type="main" key="praecursi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecursĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37478.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a coming</hi> or <hi rend="ital">going before.</hi> *</sense><sense id="n37478.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">sine praecursione visorum,</quote> <trans><tr>without a previous occurrence of phenomena</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 19, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37478.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. *</sense><sense id="n37478.3" n="A" level="2"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">a preliminary combat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a skirmish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 13, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37478.4" n="B" level="2"> In rhet. lang., <hi rend="ital">a preparation</hi> of the hearer, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:15:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 15, 59</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37478.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The office</hi> or <hi rend="ital">work of a forerunner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the mission of John the Baptist</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Tract. in Johan. 4:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Tract. in Johan. 4, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praecursor: <entryFree id="n37479" type="main" key="praecursor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecursor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37479.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who runs before.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37479.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A forerunner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precursor</hi>, of a servant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:76" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 76</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.; one who precedes on the same path</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 7, 3</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Esp.,</quote> <trans><tr>the forerunner of Christ</tr>, <tr>John the Baptist</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Tract. in Johan. 4:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Tract. in Johan. 4, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:4:8" default="NO">4, 8</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n37479.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">flos praecursor indolis bonae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nazar.</author> Pan. Const. 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n37479.3" n="III" level="1"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">an advanced guard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vanguard</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n37479.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a scout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spy</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">emissarius, speculator),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:41:section=108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 41, § 108</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1416" /> <cb n="PRAE" /></sense></entryFree>
praecursorius: <entryFree id="n37480" type="main" key="praecurso_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecursōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>praecursor</etym>, <sense id="n37480.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">precursory</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">epistula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">index,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 1, 2</bibl></cit> (al. procursorius).</sense></entryFree>
praecursus: <entryFree id="n37481" type="main" key="praecursus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecursus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praecurro.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37482" type="main" key="praecursus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praecursus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>praecurro</etym>, <sense id="n37482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a forerunning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coming before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anticipation</hi> (post - Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Etesiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 25, 42, § 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecursu quodam gloriosae passionis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 5, 109</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praecutio: <entryFree id="n37483" type="main" key="praecu^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-cŭtĭo</orth>, <itype>cussi, cussum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>quatio</etym>, <sense id="n37483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wave</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">brandish before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in front</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">taedas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:757" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 757</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:15:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 15, 16</bibl>, the true reading is percutit).</sense></entryFree>
praeda: <entryFree id="n37484" type="main" key="praeda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (old <sense id="n37484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi> PRAEDAD. Inscr. Col. Rostr.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>for praehenda, from praehendo, v. prehendo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">property taken in war</hi>, <hi rend="ital">booty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spoil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pillage</hi> (syn.: exuviae, spolium). </sense><sense id="n37484.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: praedā exercitus undat, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 2, 437</bibl> (Ann. v. 320 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">praedas ac manubias in urbis ornamenta conferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:23:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 23, 61</bibl></cit>; cf. manubiae, and the passages there cited with praeda; so <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedarum in parte repertā frangebat pocula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:101" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 101</bibl></cit>.—Mostly <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeda ante parta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 11, 28</bibl></cit>: praedam capere de praedonibus <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedam militibus donare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victores praedā spoliisque potiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:450" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 450</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37484.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37484.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An animal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bird</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">caught</hi> or <hi rend="ital">killed in the chase; prey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">game</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">cervi luporum praeda rapacium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 223</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 55, 81, § 219</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of fishing,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:936" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 936</bibl>: in saltu venantur aves; <cit><quote lang="la">hinc praeda cubili Ponitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:82" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 82</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">praeda canum lepus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:22:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 22, 5</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of a person, <hi rend="ital">prey</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 51</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37484.4" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">booty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spoil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa, quae empta ex praedā est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeste, sultis, praeda erit praesentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximos quaestus praedasque facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:50:section=119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 50, § 119</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostendit praedam,</quote> <trans><tr>treasure trove</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quibus magnas praedas Agesilaus faciebat,</quote> <trans><tr>from which Agesilaus drew great advantage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr. 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 1, 3, § 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praedabundus: <entryFree id="n37485" type="main" key="praeda_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>praedor</etym>, <sense id="n37485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ravaging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pillaging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plundering</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 90:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 90, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:1:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 1, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praedamnatio: <entryFree id="n37486" type="main" key="praedamna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedamnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praedamno</etym>, <sense id="n37486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">precondemnation</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Habit. Mul. 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Apol. 27 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
