praedamno: <entryFree id="n37487" type="main" key="praedamno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-damno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to condemn beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to precondemn</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n37487.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedamnatus collega,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37487.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: spem, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to give it up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">renounce beforehand</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 18, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se perpetuae infelicitatis,</quote> <trans><tr>think themselves condemned to perpetual misery</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praedaticius: <entryFree id="n37488" type="main" key="praeda_ti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedātīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>praedor</etym>, <sense id="n37488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">taken as booty</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plunder</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24:28" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 24, 28</bibl></cit> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:18:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 18, 12</bibl>, the better reading is praedatae).</sense></entryFree>
praedatio: <entryFree id="n37489" type="main" key="praeda_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37489.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a taking of booty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plundering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pillaging</hi> (post-Aug.).— In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">latrociniis ac praedationibus infestato mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:73:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 73, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 29</bibl>. —In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 9, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praedator: <entryFree id="n37490" type="main" key="praeda_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plunderer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pillager.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37490.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quos ego in eodem genere praedatorum direptorumque pono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus, praedator ex sociis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 44:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 44, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37490.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37490.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A hunter</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">praedator aprorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 306</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:316" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 316</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a ravisher</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 85, 3</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n37490.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A rapacious</hi> or <hi rend="ital">avaricious man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:43" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praedatorius: <entryFree id="n37491" type="main" key="praeda_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>praeda</etym>, <sense id="n37491.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">plundering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapacious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">predatory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus (militum),</quote> <trans><tr>marauders</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 20, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <trans><tr>pirate-ships</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 2, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">classes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praedatrix: <entryFree id="n37492" type="main" key="praeda_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praedator</etym>, <sense id="n37492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that plunders</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pillages</hi>, <hi rend="ital">robs</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): Herculei praedatrix cedat alumni, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the nymph Dryope</hi>, who stole away Hylas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:5:22" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 5, 22</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bestia,</quote> <trans><tr>a beast of prey</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 10, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praedatum: <entryFree id="n37493" type="main" key="praeda_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. praedor <sense id="n37493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> <cb n="PRAE" /></sense></entryFree>
praedatus: <entryFree id="n37494" type="main" key="praeda_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. praedor and praedo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37495" type="main" key="praeda^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-dătus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [do], <sense id="n37495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">given beforehand</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:37" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 37 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:3:17" default="NO">3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:2:1" default="NO">2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:3:7" default="NO">3, 7</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praedecessor: <entryFree id="n37496" type="main" key="praede_cessor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-dēcessor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n37496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a predecessor</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 10:47" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 10, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Rutil.</author> Nam. 1, 424</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praedelasso: <entryFree id="n37497" type="hapax" key="praede_lasso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-dēlasso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to weary out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">weaken beforehand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (moles) incursus praedelassat aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:731" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 731</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praedelegatio: <entryFree id="n37498" type="main" key="praede_le_ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-dēlēgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n37498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an assignment</hi> or <hi rend="ital">delegation before the time</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 5, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praedemonstro: <entryFree id="n37499" type="main" key="praede_monstro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-dēmonstro</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37499.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to demonstrate beforehand</hi> (late Lat.), Rustic. cont. Aceph. p. 1192.</sense></entryFree>
praedensus: <entryFree id="n37500" type="main" key="praedensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-densus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very thick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very dense</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">farrago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 16, 41, § 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 7, 10, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 18, 48, § 171</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praedesignatus: <entryFree id="n37501" type="main" key="praede_signa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-dēsignātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [designo], <sense id="n37501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">designated beforehand</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">praedesignatus vobis Christus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
praedestinatio: <entryFree id="n37502" type="main" key="praedesti^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedestĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praedestino</etym>, <sense id="n37502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a determining beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">predestination</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Boëth. Consol. Phil. 4; in the title of a book by Augustin.: De praedestinatione Sanctorum, et saep.</sense></entryFree>
praedestino: <entryFree id="n37503" type="main" key="praedesti^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-destĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to determine beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to predestine</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">triumphos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui praedestinavit nos in adoptionem filiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,010:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eph. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptiarum gaudia sibi, Auct. Paneg. ad Max. et Constant. 7: alicui trinam indolem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 12, 67</bibl></cit>; Augustin. Don. Persev. 21.—</sense><sense id="n37503.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To provide beforehand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavea modico praedestinata pretio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praedetermino: <entryFree id="n37504" type="main" key="praede_termi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-dētermĭno</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fix beforehand</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Orat. p. 1126" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Orat. p. 1126</bibl>, t. 47 Migne.</sense></entryFree>
praedexter: <entryFree id="n37505" type="hapax" key="praedexter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-dexter</orth>, <itype>tĕra, tĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very skilful</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 67</bibl> (acc. to Barth, i. q. ambidexter, aequimanus).</sense></entryFree>
praediator: <entryFree id="n37506" type="main" key="praedi^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>praedium</etym>, <sense id="n37506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a purchaser of mortgaged estates sold at auction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dealer in landed estates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui mercatur a populo praediator appellatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:61" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 61</bibl></cit>. Persons who followed this business were familiar with mercantile law, and were often consulted as lawyers, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:20:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 20, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:3:54" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 3, 54</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi>: praediator, <foreign lang="greek">w)nhth\s u(parxo/ntwn</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
praediatorius: <entryFree id="n37507" type="main" key="praedi^a_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedĭātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>praediator</etym>, <sense id="n37507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">relating to the sale of estates at auction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prediatory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:20:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 20, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:12:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 12, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praediatura: <entryFree id="n37508" type="hapax" key="praedi^a_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedĭātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praedium</etym>, <sense id="n37508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the purchase of estates at auction</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:61" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praediatus: <entryFree id="n37509" type="main" key="praedi^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n37509.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Possessing landed properly</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">bene praediatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 349, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37509.1" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">wealthy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omnibus praediatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37509.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Who pledges his lands to the State</hi>: praediatus <foreign lang="greek">u(pe\r fo/rou dh/mou e)ndedeme/nos</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
praedicabilis: <entryFree id="n37510" type="hapax" key="praedi^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedĭcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. praedico</etym>, <sense id="n37510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">praiseworthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laudable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid praedicabile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:17:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 17, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 1, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praedicamentum: <entryFree id="n37511" type="main" key="praedi^ca_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedĭcāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which is predicated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a quality;</hi> in <number>plur.</number> = categoriae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 4:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trin. 5:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Trin. 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 2, 16, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praedicatio: <entryFree id="n37512" type="main" key="praedi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n37512.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A public proclaiming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a proclamation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">publication</hi> (class.) of the praeco, luctuosa et acerba praedicatio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:18:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 18, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandata praedicatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 176, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedicatio societatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:61:section=140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 61, § 140</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <hi rend="ital">an assertion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem praedicationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 383</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37512.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A praising</hi>, <hi rend="ital">praise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commendation</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">praedicatio tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:14:section=41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 14, § 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">grata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 10, 42, § 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:49:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 49, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:63" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 63</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 3, 5, § 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37512.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A prediction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophecy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soothsaying</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 21, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Chron. 1, 36, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37512.3" n="IV" level="1"> (Eccl. Lat.) <hi rend="ital">Preaching</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultitia praedicationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 1, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,017:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Tit. 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praedicativus: <entryFree id="n37513" type="main" key="praedi^ca_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedĭcātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">declaring</hi>,<cb n="PRAE" />  <hi rend="ital">asserting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">predicative</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">propositio,</quote> <trans><tr>categorical</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">syllogismus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 343</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
praedicator: <entryFree id="n37514" type="main" key="praedi^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedĭcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. praedico</etym>. <sense id="n37514.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">one who makes a thing publicly known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a proclaimer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">publisher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crier</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 176, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37514.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n37514.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">One who publicly commends a thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a praiser</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eulogist</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">beneficii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te ipso praedicatore ac teste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 33, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37514.3" n="B" level="2"> In eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">a preacher</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 28 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentium (cf. Paul),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Ep. 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Tim. 2, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praedicatorius: <entryFree id="n37515" type="main" key="praedi^ca_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedĭcātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>praedicator</etym>, <sense id="n37515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">praising</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laudatory</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> adv. Avar. 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
praedicatrix: <entryFree id="n37516" type="main" key="praedi^ca_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedĭcātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37516.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that makes known</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">summarum potestatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praedico: <entryFree id="n37517" type="main" key="praedi^co1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-dĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n37517.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To cry in public</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make known by crying in public</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to publish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proclaim.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37517.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of a public crier: <cit><quote lang="la">ut praeco praedicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctionem praedicem, ipse ut venditem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 41</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si palam praeco praedicasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:16:section=40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 16, § 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 15, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:13:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 13, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37517.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37517.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to make publicly known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to announce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proclaim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to say</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">state</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declare</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">moneo, ante denuntio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:12:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 12, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 15, 43</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">class.): audes mihi praedicare id, Domi te esse?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera praedico,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliam nunc mihi orationem despoliato praedicas, atque olim,</quote> <trans><tr>you tell a different story</tr>, <tr>speak another language</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum taceamne an praedicem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quidem haec vera praedicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 3, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ingenti magnitudine corporum Germanos esse praedicabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 48:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 48, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:106:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 106, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbari paucitatemque nostrorum militum suis praedicaverunt,</quote> <trans><tr>reported</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 4, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriam in eripiendis legionibus praedicat,</quote> <trans><tr>displays</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 32, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut praedicas,</quote> <trans><tr>as you assert</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod mihi praedicabas vitium, id tibi est,</quote> <trans><tr>that you attribute to me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avus tuus tibi aediliciam praedicaret repulsam,</quote> <trans><tr>would tell you of the repulse that P. Nasica suffered respecting the edileship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:21:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 21, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37517.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to praise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vaunt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extol</hi> (syn.: laudo, celebro); constr. with <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi> (<hi rend="ital">de aliquo</hi>), <hi rend="ital">de aliquā re</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ego ejus tibi nunc faciem praedicem aut laudem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beata vita glorianda et praedicanda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:17:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 17, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 19, § 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid miris laudibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 5, 18, § 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:130" default="NO" valid="yes">13, 24, 47, § 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 54</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galli se omnes ab Dite patre prognatos praedicant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae de illo viro Sulla, quam graviter saepe praedicaverunt!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 13, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui possit idem de se praedicare, numquam se plus agere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 1, 2</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">de aliquā re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui de meis in vos meritis praedicaturus non sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 32</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui benefacta sua verbis adornant, non ideo praedicare, quia fecerint, sed, ut praedicarent, fecisse creduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verecundia in praedicando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n37517.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To preach</hi> the gospel (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">evangelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">baptismum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marc. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 4, 17</bibl> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n37517.6" n="II" level="1"> For praedicere, <hi rend="ital">to foretell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">predict</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">persecutiones eos passuros praedicabat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Fug. in Persec. 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">persecutiones praedicatae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37518" type="main" key="praedi_co2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-dīco</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to say</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mention before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to premise.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37518.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (mostly post-Aug.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">praefor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc primum in hac re praedico tibi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Davus dudum praedixit mihi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 21</bibl></cit>; 1, 2, 34; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tria, quae praediximus,</quote> <trans><tr>have mentioned before</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:24" default="NO">2, 4, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedicta ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 52</bibl></cit>: ratio ejus in medicinā similis praedictis. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 13, 37, § 136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 14, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37518.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n37518.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To foretell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">predict; to forebode</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">defectiones solis et lunae multo ante praedicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 14, 49</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">eclipsim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 12, 9, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">futura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; Petr. <pb n="1417" /> <cb n="PRAE" /> 137 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil adversi accidit non praedicente me,</quote> <trans><tr>that I had not predicted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:32:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 32, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum hoc nobis De caelo tactas memini praedicere quercus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos luctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:713" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 713</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37518.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To give notice</hi> or <hi rend="ital">warning of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to appoint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fix</hi> (mostly post-Aug.), Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 197, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi praetor reo atque accusatoribus diem praedixisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedictā die,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insula Batavorum in quam convenirent praedicta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 23, 31, § 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedicta hora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37518.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To say what one should do</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to advise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">admonish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inform</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">command</hi> (class.; syn.: praecipio, moneo); usually constr. with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeius suis praedixerat, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 92</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:60" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 19, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei visam esse Junonem praedicere, ne id faceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 24, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedixit, ne destinatum iter peterent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:82:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 82, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 36</bibl>; cf. in the <hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedicto, ne in re publicā haberetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 33</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum illud tibi ... Praedicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 436</bibl></cit>; cf. with an <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mummius jussit praedici conducentibus, si eas (statuas) perdidissent, novas eos reddituros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:13:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> of a physician, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:6:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 6, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37518.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To proclaim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">announce</hi> at an auction, etc. (cf. 1. praedico, I. A.): <cit><quote lang="la">si in auctione praedictum est, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:126" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 126</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praedictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">previously named</hi>, <hi rend="ital">before mentioned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preceding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicina praedictae sed amplior virtus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:83" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posterior ex praedictis locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:74" default="NO">10, 1, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul pedes, eques, classis aput praedictum amnem convenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 23, 31, § 76</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">praedictum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n37518.7" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to II. A.) <hi rend="ital">A foretelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prediction</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. praesagium): Chaldaeorum praedicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:42:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 42, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">astrologorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 42, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:12:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 12, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:464" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 464</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haruspicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 7, 5, § 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:460" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 460</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37518.8" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to II. C.) <hi rend="ital">An order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">command</hi> (Livian): <cit><quote lang="la">praedictum erat dictatoris ne quid absente eo rei gereret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 19, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37518.9" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An agreement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concert</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut ex praedicto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 6, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praedictio: <entryFree id="n37519" type="main" key="praedicti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedictĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. praedico</etym>. <sense id="n37519.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A premising</hi>, in rhet., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37519.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A foretelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prediction.</hi>—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedictio mali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:25:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 25, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 42, 87</bibl> sq. —In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">vatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praedictivus: <entryFree id="n37520" type="main" key="praedicti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedictīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37520.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">foretelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">predictive;</hi> in medicine, <hi rend="ital">prognosticating</hi>: item libro praedictivo, quem <foreign lang="greek">prorrhtiko/n</foreign> appellavit (Hippocrates), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:12:100" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 12, 100</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praedictum: <entryFree id="n37521" type="main" key="praedictum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedictum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. 2. praedico <sense id="n37521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praedictus: <entryFree id="n37522" type="main" key="praedictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 2. praedico.</entryFree>
praedifficilis: <entryFree id="n37523" type="main" key="praediffi^ci^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-diffĭcĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very difficult</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Bapt. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
praedigestus: <entryFree id="n37524" type="hapax" key="praedi_gestus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-dīgestus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>digero</etym>, <sense id="n37524.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has well digested</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:2:41" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 2, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praediolum: <entryFree id="n37525" type="main" key="praedi^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>praedium</etym>, <sense id="n37525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small farm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">estate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:27:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 27, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 24, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praedirus: <entryFree id="n37526" type="main" key="praedi_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-dīrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very frightful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detestable</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">facta dictu visuque praedira,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 8</bibl></cit>: mulier, Poët. ap. Anth. Lat. 2, p. 329 Burm.</sense></entryFree>
praedisco: <entryFree id="n37527" type="main" key="praedisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-disco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to learn beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make one's self acquainted with beforehand</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:32:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 32, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventos et varium caeli praediscere morem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic ut praediscere possimus, utrum sit perseverans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:18:104" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 18, 104</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praedispositus: <entryFree id="n37528" type="hapax" key="praedispo^si^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-dispŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [dispono], <sense id="n37528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">prepared beforehand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 56 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
praeditus: <entryFree id="n37529" type="main" key="praedi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-dĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [do]. <sense id="n37529.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Endowed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gifted</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">provided with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">possessed of</hi> something (above others) (freq. and class.; syn.: instructus, ornatus); constr. with <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones pulchris armis praeditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divino praedita sensu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immortali sunt haec naturā praedita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvis opibus ac facultatibus praeditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:21:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 21, 69</bibl></cit>: mundus praeditus animo et sensibus, <cb n="PRAE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:8:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 8, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvo metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:14:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 14, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulari cupiditate, audaciā, scelere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeditus levitate, egestate, perfidiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulari immanitate et crudelitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitio grandi et perspicuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:47:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 47, 88</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37529.1" n="II" level="1"> Of a deity, like praepositus, <hi rend="ital">placed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">set over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presiding over</hi> any thing (post-Aug.); constr. with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: deus ei rei praeditus, M. Aur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. 3:9" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. 3, 9</bibl> Mai: Mercurius nuntiis praeditus, Front. Eloqu. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus praedita optimati amori,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 281 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praedium: <entryFree id="n37530" type="main" key="praedi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>for prae-hendium, from praehendo, v. prehendo</etym>, <sense id="n37530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a farm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">estate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a manor</hi> (either in town or country): <cit><quote lang="la">praedibus et praediis populo cautum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:54:section=142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 54, § 142</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 55, § 143</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbanum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 86</bibl></cit>, § 199; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 60</bibl>; Cato ap. Fest. s. v. quadrantal, p. 258 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot praedia, tam pulchra, tam fructuosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 15, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habet in urbanis praediis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:86:section=109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 86, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc in praedia rustica relegarat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:15:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus praediorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:72:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 72, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">natis dividere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbana praedia omnia aedificia accipimus, non solum ea, quae sunt in oppidis, sed et si forte stabula sunt, vel alia meritoria in villis et in vicis, vel si praetoria voluptati tantum deservientia, quia urbanum praedium non locus facit, sed materia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:198" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedia Appula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:54" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedia tam urbana quam rustica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:120" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedia principio insulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 28, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praedives: <entryFree id="n37531" type="main" key="praedi_ve^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-dīvĕs</orth>, <itype>ĭtis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very rich</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very plentiful</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. inops pecuniae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedives et praepotens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Senecae praedivitis hortos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:16" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Licinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:306" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 306</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedivite cornu Auctumnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 91</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praedivinatio: <entryFree id="n37532" type="main" key="praedi_vi_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedīvīnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praedivino</etym>, <sense id="n37532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a divining beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presentiment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 25, 37, § 89</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praedivino: <entryFree id="n37533" type="main" key="praedi_vi_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-dīvīno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37533.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to have a presentiment of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to divine beforehand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui futura praedivinando soleant fari, fatidici dicti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=52" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 52</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 3, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes praedivinant ventos imbresque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 10, 10, § 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praedivinus: <entryFree id="n37534" type="main" key="praedi_vi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-dīvīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">presaging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophetic</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">praedivina somnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 60, § 167</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27, 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praedo: <entryFree id="n37535" type="main" key="praedo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. praedor <sense id="n37535.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37536" type="main" key="praedo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>praeda</etym>, <sense id="n37536.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that makes booty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a plunderer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">robber</hi> (syn.: latro, raptor). </sense><sense id="n37536.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita in aedibus sunt fures, praedo in proximo'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes sunt, quibus bellum publice populus Romanus decrevit, vel ipsi populo Romano. Ceteri latrunculi vel praedones appellantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:15:24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 15, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 21, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes piratis praedonibusque patefactae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut praedones solent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">21: nefarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedones latronesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritimus,</quote> <trans><tr>a pirate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so alone: capiunt praedones navem illam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfidus, alta petens, abductā virgine, praedo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 362</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedo nuptiarum mearum, i. e. the murderer of my husband,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 207, 17</bibl></cit>: at neque Persephone digna est praedone marito, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of Pluto</hi>, who had stolen her, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:591" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 591</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alibi praedo, alibi praedae vindex, cadit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37536.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of drones, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 15</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the hawk,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:116" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 116</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of persons who turn to their own use the property of others,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:3:25" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 3, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:4:13" default="NO">9, 4, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praedoceo: <entryFree id="n37537" type="main" key="praedo^ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-dŏcĕo</orth>, <itype>cŭi, ctum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to teach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instruct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inform beforehand</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">illi praedocti a duce arma mutaverant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 94:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 94, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedoctus esto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:334" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 34, 77, § 334</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">myrrheus Pulvis sepulcrum praedocet,</quote> <trans><tr>points out</tr>, <tr>shows</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 12, 72</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praedomo: <entryFree id="n37538" type="hapax" key="praedo^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-dŏmo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37538.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tame</hi> or <hi rend="ital">subdue beforehand</hi>: omnes casus praedomuit meditando, <hi rend="ital">mastered</hi> or <hi rend="ital">surmounted beforehand</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 113:22" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 113, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praedonius: <entryFree id="n37539" type="hapax" key="praedo_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. praedo</etym>, <sense id="n37539.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">predatory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">more,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:3:25" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 3, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praedonulus: <entryFree id="n37540" type="greek" key="praedo_nu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedōnŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37540.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little robber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">petty robber</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=242" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 242</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
praedopiont: <entryFree id="n37541" type="gloss" key="praedopi^ont"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedopĭont</orth>, <itype>praeoptant</itype>, Fest. <cb n="PRAE" /> p. 205 Müll. [praed-opio, ĕre, as the prim. form of opto; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=204" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 204</bibl>, a, Müll.].</entryFree>
praedor: <entryFree id="n37542" type="main" key="praedor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype> (active collat. form, <sense id="n37542.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [2. praedo]. </sense><sense id="n37542.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make booty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to plunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spoil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rob</hi> (in war and otherwise; class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: spolio, diripio): spes rapiendi atque praedandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 4, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licentia praedandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedantes milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hereditate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:18:section=45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 18, § 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 3, § 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 20, § 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedatum exire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessitate inpositā ex alieno praedandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex alienis fortunis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:41:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 41, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex necessitate alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 18, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex agris finitimorum praedari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:1:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 23, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis pluribus locis praedata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de aratorum bonis praedari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:78:section=182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 78, § 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedari in re frumentariā et in bonis aratorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 62</bibl></cit>, § 146; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 3, 88, § 204: in bonis alienis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 19</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">46: omnibus in rebus,</quote> <trans><tr>upon every opportunity</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 50</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">130: in insulis cultorum egentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 31, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex alterius inscientiā praedari,</quote> <trans><tr>to make use of another's ignorance to defraud him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:17:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 17, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum apud tuos Mamertinos inveniare improbissimā ratione esse praedatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:1:section=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37542.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praedātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">that has made booty;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">well furnished with booty</hi> (Plautinian): <cit><quote lang="la">bene ego ab hoc praedatus ibo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 115</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37542.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to plunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pillage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rob</hi> any thing (rare before the Aug. period). </sense><sense id="n37542.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastorum stabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 5, 13</bibl></cit> Halm <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> B. and K.; <cit><quote lang="la">dub. (al. praeclara cepisset): dum socios magis quam hostes praedatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arces Cecropis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:647" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 647</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 9 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 17, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona vivorum et mortuorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 12</bibl></cit> (but cf. Roth ad loc.): <cit><quote lang="la">Hylam Nympha praedata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37542.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to take</hi> or <hi rend="ital">catch</hi> animals, birds, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">alia dentibus praedantur, alia unguibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 71, 91, § 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ovem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 419</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces calamo praedabor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 2, 37.—</sense><sense id="n37542.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to rob</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">amores alicujus,</quote> <trans><tr>to rob one of his mistress</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:8:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 8, 59</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae me nuper praedata puella est,</quote> <trans><tr>has caught me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singula de nobis anni praedantur euntes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dapes,</quote> <trans><tr>to consume</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:429" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 429</bibl></cit>.!*? <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">praedo</orth>, āre: <cit><quote lang="la">praedavit omnes filios Tharsis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jud. 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 799</bibl> P.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-dor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, in a <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif. (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mihi istaec videtur praeda praedatum irier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra direptione praedabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 24, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae praedatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:18:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 18, 12</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praedātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that which has been obtained by plunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">booty</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Prob. 8, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praedotiont: <entryFree id="n37543" type="gloss" key="praedoti^ont"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedotĭont</orth>, v. praedopiont.</entryFree>
praeduco: <entryFree id="n37544" type="main" key="praedu_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-dūco</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to draw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">put before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in front</hi> (not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">fossam et maceriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossas transversas viis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:83" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossas muris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:411" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 411</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:8:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 8, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">murum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lineas itineri,</quote> <trans><tr>to mark out the way by drawn lines</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 75</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeductal: <entryFree id="n37545" type="gloss" key="praeductal"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeductal</orth>, <itype>ālis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>praeduco</etym>, <sense id="n37545.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pencil for drawing lines</hi>: praeductal, <foreign lang="greek">para/grafos</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
praeductorius: <entryFree id="n37546" type="hapax" key="praeducto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeductōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for drawing forwards</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lora,</quote> <trans><tr>traces</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 135, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeductus: <entryFree id="n37547" type="main" key="praeductus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeductus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praeduco.</entryFree>
praedulce: <entryFree id="n37548" type="main" key="praedulce"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praedulce</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. praedulcis <sense id="n37548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praedulcis: <entryFree id="n37549" type="main" key="praedulcis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-dulcis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n37549.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">very sweet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">luscious</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">mel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 18, 19, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 5, 11, § 23</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praedulcĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">over-sweet things</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 1, 1, § 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37549.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">very pleasing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">delightful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedulcis eloquii suavitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 17, 18, § 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:56" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedulce illud genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum (luxuries),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> I. Cons. Stil. 2, 132</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praedulce</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very sweetly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyrrhenae volucres (i.e. Sirenes) nautis praedulce minantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:82" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 82</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeduro: <entryFree id="n37550" type="main" key="praedu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-dūro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n37550.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make very hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harden very much</hi> (postAug.):<pb n="1418" /> <cb n="PRAE" />  sucus praeduratus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 71, § 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:6:9" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:7:4" default="NO">7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8" default="NO">8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37550.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to harden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indurate</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 5, 177.</sense></entryFree>
praedurus: <entryFree id="n37551" type="main" key="praedu_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-dūrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37551.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very hard</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n37551.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">faba praedura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 12, 30, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 8, 29, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 29, 46, § 85</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:66" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 66</bibl></cit> (al. perjurus).—</sense><sense id="n37551.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">very strong</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo praedurus viribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:748" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 748</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:531" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 531</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 349</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37551.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">very hard</hi> or <hi rend="ital">difficult</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very harsh</hi>, etc.: aetas, i. e. <hi rend="ital">hardy</hi> (opp. tenera), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:235" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt quidam praeduri oris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>very impudent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <trans><tr>very harsh</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 26</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praedurē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">very hardy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Pr. Mar. 488</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeeligo: <entryFree id="n37552" type="hapax" key="praee_li^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-ēlĭgo</orth>, <itype>lēgi, ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to choose rather</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prefer;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeeminentia: <entryFree id="n37553" type="main" key="praee_mi^nenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-ēmĭnentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n37553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pre-eminence</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">negotii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 1 praef.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
praeemineo: <entryFree id="n37554" type="main" key="praee_mi^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-ēmĭnĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">praem-</orth>), <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n37554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to project forwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be prominent.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37554.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 6:9" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H.
