Fragm. 2, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeeminentes oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 12</bibl></cit> (al. eminentes).—</sense><sense id="n37554.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to surpass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excel</hi> (post-Aug. for emineo, excello, praesto, etc.); constr. with <case>dat.</case> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui Graecis praeeminet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:4:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit> (dub. Burs. Graecos): <cit><quote lang="la">genitis, Aus. Caes. n. 15: Cassius ceteros praeeminebat peritiā legum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">appellatione aliqua cetera imperia praemineret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 56</bibl></cit>; 12, 33; 15, 34.</sense></entryFree>
praeemptor: <entryFree id="n37555" type="gloss" key="praeemptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-emptor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>emo</etym>, <sense id="n37555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who purchases before others</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pre-emptor</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">proagorasth/s</foreign>, praeemptor, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
praeeo: <entryFree id="n37556" type="main" key="praee^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-ĕo</orth> (sometimes written in inscrr. with one e, PRAERAT, etc.), īvi and <itype>ĭi, ĭtum, īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n37556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lead the way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precede</hi> (syn.: praegredior, antecedo). </sense><sense id="n37556.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37556.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut consulibus lictores praeirent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:31:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 31, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domino praeire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:519" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 519</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Laevinus Romam praeivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetor dictus, qui praeiret jure et exercitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=80" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 80</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in re militari praetor dictus, qui praeiret exercitui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 5:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 16</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">87 ib.: praeeunte carinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 186</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:81" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 81</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37556.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per avia ac derupta praeibat eum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludos Circenses eburna effigies (Germanici) praeiret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37556.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37556.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to go before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precede</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n37556.6" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturā praeeunte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:21:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 21, 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37556.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acto raptim agmine, ut famam sui praeiret,</quote> <trans><tr>to outstrip</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37556.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic., a relig. and publicist's t. t., <hi rend="ital">to precede</hi> one <hi rend="ital">in reciting a formula</hi> (as of prayer, consecration, an oath, etc.), i. e. <hi rend="ital">to repeat first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dictate</hi> any thing (the predom. signif. of the word); constr. most freq. with <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi> (<hi rend="ital">alicui</hi>), and less freq. with <hi rend="ital">verbis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">voce</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37556.9" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquid</hi> (<hi rend="ital">alicui</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">praei verba, quibus me pro legionibus devoveam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedem Concordiae dedicavit, coactusque pontifex maximus verba praeire,</quote> <trans><tr>to dictate the formula of consecration</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 46, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 21, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 41, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:28:14" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 28, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeeuntibus exsecrabile carmen sacerdotibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacramentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsecrationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum scriba ex publicis tabulis sollemne ei praecationis carmen praeiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:1:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37556.10" n="(b)" level="5"> Praeire verbis: <cit><quote lang="la">praei verbis quid vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37556.11" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, with <hi rend="ital">dat. of the person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeivimus commilitonibus jusjurandum more sollemni praestantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10,52</bibl></cit> (60): <cit><quote lang="la">de scripto praeire,</quote> <trans><tr>to read before</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 3, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ades, Luculle, Servili, dum dedico domum Ciceronis, ut mihi praeeatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:52:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 52, 133</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37556.12" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, apart from technical lang., <hi rend="ital">to recite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">read</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sing</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">play before</hi> one (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut vobis voce praeirent, quid judicaretis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si legentibus singulis praeire semper ipsi velint,</quote> <trans><tr>wish to read before</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:12" default="NO">1, 2, 12</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">praeeunte aliquā jucundā voce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibiam Caio Graccho cum populo agenti praeisse ac praemonstrasse modulos ferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 11, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37556.13" n="b" level="4"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to lead the way</hi>, by orders, directions, precepts: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia, uti decemviri praeierunt, facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (cf. praefor): <cit><quote lang="la">si de omni quoque officio judicis praeire tibi me vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14</bibl></cit>, <cb n="PRAE" /> 2, 12.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praeiens</orth>, <mood>Part.</mood>, <hi rend="ital">going before;</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praeiens</orth>, <itype>euntis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">he who precedes</hi> another, as <hi rend="ital">a precentor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">leader</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectio non omnis nec semper praeeunte eget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeesus: <entryFree id="n37557" type="gloss" key="praee_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeēsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [prae-edo], <sense id="n37557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">eaten before</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 166</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeexercitamentum: <entryFree id="n37558" type="main" key="praeexerci^ta_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-exercĭtāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n37558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a previous</hi> or <hi rend="ital">preparatory exercise</hi> (postclass.), as a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">progumna/smata</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1329</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
praefacilis: <entryFree id="n37559" type="gloss" key="praefa^ci^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-făcĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very easy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praefactus: <entryFree id="n37560" type="main" key="praefactus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praefactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1. praefectus.</entryFree>
praefamen: <entryFree id="n37561" type="main" key="praefa_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-fāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>praefor</etym>, <sense id="n37561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a preface</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 2:34" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 2, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praefandus: <entryFree id="n37562" type="main" key="praefandus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praefandus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> of praefor, q. v.</entryFree>
praefascine: <entryFree id="n37563" type="main" key="praefascine_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praefascinē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. praefiscine.</entryFree>
praefatigatus: <entryFree id="n37564" type="main" key="praefa^ti_ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-fătīgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, <sense id="n37564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wearied beforehand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatigatus (late Lat.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:7:84" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 7, 84</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praefatio: <entryFree id="n37565" type="main" key="praefa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praefātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praefor</etym>, <sense id="n37565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a saying beforehand;</hi> concr., </sense><sense id="n37565.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That which is said</hi> or <hi rend="ital">repeated beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a form of words</hi> (esp. relig. or jurid.), <hi rend="ital">formula</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefatio donationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:80:section=186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 80, § 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:3:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 26, 27, § 98</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37565.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A preliminary hearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an introductory address</hi> (law t. t.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:134" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 1, 134</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37565.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That which precedes a discourse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">writing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a preface</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prologue</hi> (post-Aug.): vocabula rustica aut externa cum honoris praefatione ponenda, <hi rend="ital">saying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by your leave</hi>, Plin. praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">13: numquam tristiorem sententiam sine praefatione clementiae pronunciavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Cassius numquam sine praefatione publici parricidii nominandus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:8:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: jucundissime Imperator (sit enim haec tui praefatio verissima), qs. <hi rend="ital">appellation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">title</hi>, Plin. praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">1: nullā praefatione factā judici rem exponere,</quote> <trans><tr>without preface</tr>, <tr>without any introduction</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—Of remarks before a recitation, designed to win the favor or avert the displeasure of hearers, <hi rend="ital">a preface;</hi> also of books: <cit><quote lang="la">praefationem dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:11:14" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 11, 14</bibl>; 4, 14, 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:31" default="NO">8, 3, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:67" default="NO">11, 1, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:18:1 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 18, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
praefatiuncula: <entryFree id="n37566" type="main" key="praefa_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praefātĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>praefatio</etym>, <sense id="n37566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a short preface</hi> or <hi rend="ital">opening</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 64</bibl>, n. 8; 112, n. 20.</sense></entryFree>
praefatum: <entryFree id="n37567" type="main" key="praefa_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praefātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. praefor <sense id="n37567.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praefatus: <entryFree id="n37568" type="main" key="praefa_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praefātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. praefor <sense id="n37568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37569" type="main" key="praefa_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praefātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>praefor</etym>, <sense id="n37569.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a saying beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a prediction</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 10:22" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 10, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praefectianus: <entryFree id="n37570" type="main" key="praefecti^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praefectĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>praefectus</etym>, <sense id="n37570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the prœtorian prefect</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">apparitor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; also <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praefectĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 53, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praefectio: <entryFree id="n37571" type="hapax" key="praefecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praefectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praeficio</etym>, <sense id="n37571.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a setting before</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a praefectione praefica dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=70" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 70</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
praefectorius: <entryFree id="n37572" type="main" key="praefecto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praefectōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>praefectus</etym>, <sense id="n37572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a prefect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <trans><tr>an ex-prefect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:9:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; also <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-fectōrĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praefectura: <entryFree id="n37573" type="main" key="praefectu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praefectūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<sense id="n37573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dat. plur.</hi> PRAEFECTVREIS, Inscr. Corp. Lat. 206, 83), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">the office of a president</hi> or <hi rend="ital">overseer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a presidency</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superintendence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prefecture.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37573.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">villae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 11</bibl> (infra, B. 2. b.): morum, <hi rend="ital">the superintendence of the public morals</hi> (a part of the duty of the censor), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc de se praefecturam servo dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 5, 14, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitum Gallorum,</quote> <trans><tr>the command of the cavalry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:12" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 14, 12, § 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:12:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 12, 1</bibl> (al. Urbi): <cit><quote lang="la">praetorio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 9:11" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefectura domūs Siculā non mitior aulā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:486" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 486</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37573.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n37573.3" n="A" level="2"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">the office of commander</hi> or <hi rend="ital">governor in the provinces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the government of a country</hi> or <hi rend="ital">town</hi> (which was conferred by the proconsuls and proprætors), <hi rend="ital">a prefectship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prefecture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefecturas sumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praefecturam petivit: negavi me cuiquam negotianti dare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 21, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multorum consulum praetorumque praefecturas delatas sic accepit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 6, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37573.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The administration of a province</hi>: aliquem <cb n="PRAE" /> ad praefecturam Aegypti provehere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:66" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aegypti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 47</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n37573.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37573.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">An Italian city governed by Roman authorities</hi> (praefecti) <hi rend="ital">and according to their edicts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a prefecture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefecturae eae appellabantur in Italiā, in quibus et jus dicebatur et nundinae agebantur, et erat quaedam earum res publica, neque tamen magistratus suos habebant, in quas legibus praefecti mittebantur quotannis qui jus dicerent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=233" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 233</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 14, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:22:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 22, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:24:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 24, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Capua in formam praefecturae redacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:44:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 44, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3699</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37573.7" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The territory of a prefecture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a district</hi>, <hi rend="ital">province</hi>, <hi rend="ital">government</hi> (anteclass. and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quin ruri es in praefecturā tuā? ... abi rus, abi directus tuam in provinciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 11</bibl></cit> and 15: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ibo in meam praefecturam, ut jus dicam lardo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aegyptus dividitur in praefecturas oppidorum, quas nomos vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 9, § 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proximae praefecturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 8</bibl></cit>: praefecturae magis quam imperia, Front. Princ. Hist. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n37573.8" n="C" level="2"> In the agrimensores, <hi rend="ital">the land allotted to a colony</hi>, Sicul. Flacc. Condit. Agr. p. 21 Goes.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Limit. p. 43" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Limit. p. 43</bibl> ib.; Aggen. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:page=56" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> p. 56</bibl> ib.</sense></entryFree>
praefectus: <entryFree id="n37574" type="main" key="praefectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-fectus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">praefactus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [facio], <sense id="n37574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">done beforehand</hi> (postclass.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:17:174" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 17, 174</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:14:218" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 2, 14, 218</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:5:4:71" default="NO">5, 4, 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n37575" type="main" key="praefectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praefectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praeficio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37576" type="main" key="praefectus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praefectus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. praeficio <sense id="n37576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praefecundus: <entryFree id="n37577" type="main" key="praefe_cundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-fēcundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very fruitful</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 17, 51, § 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praefericulum: <entryFree id="n37578" type="gloss" key="praefe^ri^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praefĕrĭcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>praefero</etym>, <sense id="n37578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a broad brazen dish used at sacrifices</hi>: praefericulum vas aëneum sine ansā patens summum, velut pelvis, quo ad sacrificia utebantur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=248" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 248</bibl> Müll. (whether at the sacrifices in honor of Ops cannot be determined, on account of the mutilated state of the words relating to it in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=249" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 249</bibl>, b).</sense></entryFree>
praefero: <entryFree id="n37579" type="main" key="praefe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-fĕro</orth>, <itype>tŭli, lātum, ferre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37579.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bear before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to carry in front</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hold forth.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37579.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37579.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">dextrā ardentem facem praeferebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:34:section=74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 34, § 74</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui facem ad libidinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fascibus insignia laureae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fasces praetoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:9:section=22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 9, § 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:336" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 336</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">claram facem praeferre pudendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:139" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 139</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37579.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> with mid. force: praelatus, <hi rend="ital">riding by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurrying past</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praelatus equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praelatos hostes adoriri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter castra sua fugā praelati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 27</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra sua praelati,</quote> <trans><tr>hurrying past the camp</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37579.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to carry in front</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bear along</hi> in public, and esp. in religious and triumphal processions: <cit><quote lang="la">signa militaria praelata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:49" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pontico triumpho trium verborum praetulit titulum: veni, vidi, vici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuam Circensi pompā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37579.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37579.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to carry before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to place</hi> or <hi rend="ital">set before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to offer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">present</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">clarissimum lumen praetulistis menti meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 14, 40</bibl></cit>: suam vitam, ut legem, praefert suis legibus, <hi rend="ital">to carry one's life before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">let it shine before</hi> as a guiding law (the image is borrowed from the bearing of torches before a thing), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:34:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 34, 52</bibl> Mos.: apud consulem causam atque excusationem, <hi rend="ital">to offer as a cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as an excuse</hi>, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 58, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37579.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n37579.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To place</hi> a person or thing <hi rend="ital">before</hi> another in esteem, <hi rend="ital">to prefer</hi> (very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">quem cui nostrum non saepe praetulit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 13, 8</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:26:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 26, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:84:342" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 84, 342</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 27, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">virtute belli praeferri omnibus nationibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 54, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam amicitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 17, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus majestatis atque imperii ipsi naturae patrioque amori, id Fin. 1, 7, 23: vestram voluntatem meis omnibus commodis et rationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:24:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 24, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo ille ... ipsis est praeferendus doctoribus ... Equidem quemadmodum urbes magnas viculis et castellis praeferendas puto, sic, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Brutus cuilibet ducum praeferendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:69:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 69, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puellam puellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 23, 25, § 94</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc pueris patriaeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:111" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 111</bibl></cit>: animam praeferre <pb n="1419" /> <cb n="PRAE" /> pudori, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 83</bibl>.—With an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to choose rather</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prefer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur alter fratrum cessare et ludere et ungi Praeferat Herodis palmetis pinguibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut multi praetulerint carere Penatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37579.9" n="2" level="3"> With ref. to time, <hi rend="ital">to take beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to anticipate</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): diem triumphi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec bonus Eurytion praelato invidit honori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:541" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 541</bibl></cit>; cf.: praelato die, Form. Praet. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:13:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:10:28" default="NO">48, 10, 28</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">opem,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring beforehand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:476" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 476</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37579.10" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">display</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhibit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reveal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">betray</hi>, etc. (rare but class.): cum praeferremus sensus aperte, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">avaritiam praefers,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:31:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 31, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons Calirrhoë aquarum gloriam ipso nomine praeferens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 16, 15, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures in equis animi indicia praeferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 50, § 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duae aquilae omen duplicis imperii praeferentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:16" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modestiam praeferre et lasciviā uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 45</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 1</bibl>, praelatis is corrupted; <cit><quote lang="la">the correct read. is privatis): dolorem animi vultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:9:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientiae studium habitu corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 22, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeferox: <entryFree id="n37580" type="main" key="praefe^rox"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-fĕrox</orth>, <itype>ōcis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very fierce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impetuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insolent</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">praeferoces legatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeferocem ingenio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multiplici successu praeferocem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeferratus: <entryFree id="n37581" type="main" key="praeferra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-ferrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37581.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tipped</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shod with iron</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">modius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilum,</quote> <trans><tr>pointed with iron</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 10, 23, § 97</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeferratus apud molas tribunus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>chained</tr>, <tr>fettered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praefertilis: <entryFree id="n37582" type="main" key="praeferti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-fertĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very fruitful</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fertile</hi> (post-class.): germen, Prud. adv <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1025" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> 2, 1025</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae ubere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> 5, 119</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praefervidus: <entryFree id="n37583" type="main" key="praefervi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-fervĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very hot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burning hot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torrid</hi> (in prose not anteAug.). </sense><sense id="n37583.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: fulgor, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 42</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 188 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">regio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">balneum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37583.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira,</quote> <trans><tr>glowing</tr>, <tr>burning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 18, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praefestinatim: <entryFree id="n37584" type="hapax" key="praefesti_na_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praefestīnātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>praefestino</etym>, <sense id="n37584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very hurriedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in hot haste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very hastily</hi>: praefestinatim et cupide, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 161, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praefestino: <entryFree id="n37585" type="main" key="praefesti_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-festīno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n37585.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To hasten before the time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hasten too much</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. or Cæs.): praefestinare praeloqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: sciscere, quae sit causa, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 186</bibl> P. (Com. Rel. p. 182 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne deficere praefestinarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefestinatum opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37585.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To hasten past</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praefica: <entryFree id="n37586" type="main" key="praefi^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praefĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praeficio</etym>, <sense id="n37586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a woman hired to lament at the head of a funeral procession</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefica dicta, ut Aurelius scribit, mulier, ad luctum quae conduceretur, quae ante domum mortui laudes ejus caneret ... Claudius scribit: quae praeficeretur ancillis quemadmodum lamentarentur, praefica est dicta. Utrumque ostendit a praefectione praeficam dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=70" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 70</bibl></cit> Müll.; Lucil., and Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 66, 31 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">superaboque omnes argutando praeficas, Plaut. ib.: sine virtute argutum civem mihi habeam pro praeficā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 14</bibl></cit>. —In apposition: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam mulierum voces praeficarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:7:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeficio: <entryFree id="n37587" type="main" key="praefi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-fĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, fectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>facio</etym>, <sense id="n37587.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to set over</hi> any thing (as officer, superintendent, leader, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to place in authority over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place at the head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appoint to the command of.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37587.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (freq. and class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praepono, praefero): te cum securi caudicali praeficio provinciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefeci rure recte qui curet tamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 1, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem pecori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:25:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 25, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certum magistratum alicui procurationi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:26:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 26, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperatorem bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:16:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 16, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantis rebus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatos legionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontifices sacris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:14:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 14, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem sacerdotio Neptuni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 8, 8, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertos rationibus, libellis et epistulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem provinciae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 46</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 4: aliquem classi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 42</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">lucis Avernis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juno sacris praefecta maritis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo exercitu inimici mei fratrem praefecerat,</quote> <trans><tr>had given him a command</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:18:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 18, 41</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n37587.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to set over</hi>, etc. (rare): nec locus nec materia invenitur, cui divinationem<cb n="PRAE" />  praeficere possimus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:4:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 4, 12</bibl>. —Hence, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praefectus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an overseer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">director</hi>, <hi rend="ital">president</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commander</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prefect.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37587.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">gumnasi praefecto poenas pendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">villae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu (censor) es praefectus moribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:46:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 46, 129</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praefectus morum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hamilc. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hamilc. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero mulieribus praefectus praeponatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:6:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 4, 6, 16</bibl></cit> (<bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 499, 13</bibl>); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum praefectus custodum quaesisset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his utitur quasi praefectis libidinum suarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Red. in Sen. 6, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37587.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., as a title of particular civil or military officers, <hi rend="ital">a president</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superintendent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commander</hi>, <hi rend="ital">governor</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">praefectus aerarii or aerario,</quote> <trans><tr>a treasurer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24:30" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 24, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. 4</bibl>: annonae, <hi rend="ital">a superintendent of grain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of the markets</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1084</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1186</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1091</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">3169: castrorum or castris,</quote> <trans><tr>an officer who attended to the pitching of the camp and all matters connected therewith</tr>, <tr>a quartermaster</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:112:6" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 112, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:119:4" default="NO">119, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:120:4" default="NO">120, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 20</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis,</quote> <trans><tr>an admiral</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:34:section=89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 34, § 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:20" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42" default="NO" valid="yes">42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 7</bibl>; afterwards also for <hi rend="ital">a captain of a ship</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 4, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3596</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">who was formerly called praefectus navis: dextrum cornu praefectos navium ad terram explicare jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 5</bibl>: fabrūm, in the army, <hi rend="ital">a superintendent of the military engines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chief engineer</hi>, Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7</bibl>, C, 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 24, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 12, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:76:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 76, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 6, 7, § 48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4906</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in the free towns and colonies,</quote> <trans><tr>a superintendent of public works</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 516</bibl></cit>: equitum, <hi rend="ital">a commander of the cavalry</hi>, as we say, <hi rend="ital">a colonel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">general of cavalry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:12" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:24:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 24, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also simply praefectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 7</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cohortium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 46:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 46, 7</bibl></cit>: legionis, in the time of the emperors, the same that was previously called legatus legionis, <hi rend="ital">a commander of the legion</hi>, i. q. our <hi rend="ital">colonel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 465, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefectus regis or regius,</quote> <trans><tr>a commander-in-chief</tr>, <tr>generalissimo</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 46:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 46, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ages. 2, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:11" default="NO">11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefectus praetorio and praetorii, in the time of the emperors,</quote> <trans><tr>a commander of the imperial body - guard</tr>, <tr>pretorian prefect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 11</bibl> et saep.; in later times, <hi rend="ital">a governor of a province of the Roman empire</hi>: praefectus urbi or urbis, <hi rend="ital">governor of the city of Rome</hi>, in the times of the republic, appointed only to represent the consul during the latter's absence; under the emperors, a perpetual office with a particular jurisdiction, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 38, 90, § 223</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3153 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilum or vigilibus,</quote> <trans><tr>a captain of the watch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:15:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 15, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:58" default="NO">47, 2, 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 801</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1088</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1929</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aegypti,</quote> <trans><tr>the governor of the province of Egypt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 709</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3651</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Lydiae, Ioniae, totiusque Phrygiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alpium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 48, 68, § 134</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 287, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praefidens: <entryFree id="n37588" type="main" key="praefi_dens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-fīdens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [fido], <sense id="n37588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">trusting too much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">over-confident</hi> (rare but class.): exsultantem te et praefidentem tibi Repriment legum habenae, <hi rend="ital">self-confident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rash</hi>, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:41:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 41, 166</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">homines sibi praefidentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:26:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 26, 90</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praefīdenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">too confidently</hi> (late Lat.); <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefidentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 55" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praefigo: <entryFree id="n37589" type="main" key="praefi_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-fīgo</orth>, <itype>xi, xum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37589.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fix</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fasten before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to set up in front</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fix on the end</hi> or <hi rend="ital">extremity of.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37589.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class., but not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">ripa erat acutis sudibus praefixis munita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 18</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">praefigere aëneos cancellos foraminibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma puppibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hastis Praefigunt capita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 466</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vexillum in biremis puppe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rostrum lupi villarum portis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 10, 44, § 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput hastae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:85" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 85</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: nigrum theta (i. e. <foreign lang="greek">*q</foreign>, as a sign of death on Roman inscriptions) vitio, <hi rend="ital">to mark crime with the black theta</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to condemn it</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:13" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37589.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">aliquid aliquā re.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37589.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To tip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">point</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">asseres cuspidibus praefixi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: jacula<cb n="PRAE" />  praefixa ferro, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aere aut ferro praefixae hastae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:2:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro praefixum robur acuto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:479" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 479</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora capistris,</quote> <trans><tr>to muzzle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:399" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 399</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37589.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To close</hi>, <hi rend="ital">block up</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">prospectus om nes,</quote> <trans><tr>to wall up</tr>, <tr>build up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 19, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fenestrae praefixae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n37589.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To pierce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transfix</hi> with something: <cit><quote lang="la">latus praefixa veru,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:55" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 55</bibl></cit> (6, 49).—* </sense><sense id="n37589.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To enchant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bewitch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 10:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 10, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praefiguratio: <entryFree id="n37590" type="main" key="praefi^gu_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praefĭgūrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praefiguro</etym>, <sense id="n37590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prefiguration</hi> (late Lat.), Aug. Civ. Dei, 16, 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 53, 8</bibl>: legis, Hilar. in Psa. 118, 3, 3.</sense></entryFree>
praefigurator: <entryFree id="n37591" type="main" key="praefi^gu_ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praefĭgūrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who prefigures</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conj. Adult. 6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conj. Adult. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praefiguro: <entryFree id="n37592" type="main" key="praefi^gu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-fĭgūro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to prefigure</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 2, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praefinio: <entryFree id="n37593" type="main" key="praefi_ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-fīnĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi and ĭi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37593.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to determine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fix</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">appoint beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prescribe</hi> (class.; a favorite word with Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: praestituo, praescribo): praefinire non est meum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:8:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid restricte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:18:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 18, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefinit successori diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 15, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad certum praefinitumque tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">dies certus praefinitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:25:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 25, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptum funerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:27:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 27, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque de illo quicquam tibi praefinio, quo minus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:68:section=174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 68, § 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefinisti, quo ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: nec res praefiniet ipsa, <hi rend="ital">limit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set bounds</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 618</bibl>.—Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">praefīnītō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">in the prescribed manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefinito loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praefinitio: <entryFree id="n37594" type="main" key="praefi_ni_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-fīnītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praefinio</etym>, <sense id="n37594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a determining</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fixing beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appointment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prescription</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:51" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:2:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 36, 2, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20" default="NO">20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,010:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eph. 3, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Monag. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praefinito: <entryFree id="n37595" type="main" key="praefi_ni_to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praefīnītō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. praefinio <sense id="n37595.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praefiscine: <entryFree id="n37596" type="main" key="praefisci^ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praefiscĭnē</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">praefiscĭni</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">praefascĭni</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>adverbial form from prae-fascinum; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 153, 12</bibl>; prop. in security against magic; cf. Corss. Ausspr. 1, 775 sq.; hence</etym>, <sense id="n37596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">meaning no evil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without offence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without vanity</hi> (mostly ante-class.): pol tu ad laudem addito praefiscini, ne puella fascinetur, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 210</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Afran. ib.: praefiscini hoc nunc dixerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 5, 2, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo praefiscini frugi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 73, 6</bibl></cit>.—Form praefascine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:24:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 24, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 210</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">praefascine dixerim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 3, 16, p. 356, 30</bibl></cit> (cf. Hildeb. ad loc.).</sense></entryFree>
praefletus: <entryFree id="n37597" type="main" key="praefle_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeflētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. perfletus.</entryFree>
praefloreo: <entryFree id="n37598" type="main" key="praeflo_re^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-flōrĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n37598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to flower</hi> or <hi rend="ital">blossom before the time</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 29, 51, § 119</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praefloro: <entryFree id="n37599" type="main" key="praeflo_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-flōro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>flos</etym>, <sense id="n37599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to deprive of its blossoms beforehand;</hi> only trop. </sense><sense id="n37599.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To lessen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diminish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tarnish</hi> (very rare, and perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">gloriam ejus victoriae praefloratam apud Thermopylas esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 58 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">decus praecerptum praefloratumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:58" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudii fructum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:36" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37599.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To deflower</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidua venit jam ab alio praeflorata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 332, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praefluo: <entryFree id="n37600" type="main" key="praeflu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-flŭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n37600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flow by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">past</hi> (rare; perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n37600.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infimā valle praefluit Tiberis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:45:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 45, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a latere urbis quod in orientem patet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 43, 31, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vado incerto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita ut (aquae tubo ductae) recte praefluere possint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 199</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37600.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aufidus, Qui regna Dauni praefluit Appuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tibur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aquileiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 18, 22, § 126</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:102" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 11, 16, § 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 3, 4, § 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pergamum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 30, 33, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Noricam provinciam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 63</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praefluus: <entryFree id="n37601" type="main" key="praeflu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeflŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>praefluo</etym>, <sense id="n37601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flowing by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">past</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 20, § 60</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praefocabilis: <entryFree id="n37602" type="main" key="praefo_ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praefōcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>praefoco</etym>, <sense id="n37602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has the power of choking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffocating</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">spiratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:35" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 3, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praefocatio: <entryFree id="n37603" type="main" key="praefo_ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praefōcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a choking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffocation</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 100" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:6" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praefoco: <entryFree id="n37604" type="main" key="praefo_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-fōco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>faux</etym>, <sense id="n37604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to choke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strangle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffocate</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and postclass. for suffoco): <cit><quote lang="la">animae viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:560" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 560</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:3:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 25, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1420" /> <cb n="PRAE" /> 29: <cit><quote lang="la">messis praefocata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:4:115" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 4, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex abundantiā praefocari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praefodio: <entryFree id="n37605" type="main" key="praefo^di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-fŏdĭo</orth>, <itype>fōdi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n37605.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To dig before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in front of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">portas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:473" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 473</bibl></cit> (id est ante portas fossas faciunt, Serv.). —</sense><sense id="n37605.1" n="II" level="1"> With respect to time, <hi rend="ital">to dig</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bury before</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scrobes,</quote> <trans><tr>to make pits beforehand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 11, 16, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <trans><tr>to bury before</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 60</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praefoecundus: <entryFree id="n37606" type="main" key="praefoecundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praefoecundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. praefecundus.</entryFree>
praefomento: <entryFree id="n37607" type="main" key="praefo_mento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-fōmento</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to warm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">foment beforehand</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera aquā gelidā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 19 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
praefor: <entryFree id="n37608" type="main" key="praefor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-for</orth>, <itype>fātus, 1</itype> (old <sense id="n37608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imper.</hi> praefato, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 134</bibl>. 1: <cit><quote lang="la">praefamino,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 141, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. Müll. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=87:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 87, 10</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37608.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to say</hi> or <hi rend="ital">utter beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to premise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preface</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in parte operis mei licet mihi praefari, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10</bibl>, praef. 5; 12, 50, 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 1</bibl>: praefatus, de summā se republicā acturum, <hi rend="ital">having first announced by edict that</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae de deorum naturā praefati sumus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum praefatus fuero, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1</bibl></cit> prooem. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:15:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 15, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi Asiam sufficere praefatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:5:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcana se et silenda afferre praefatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:7:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is cum praefatus esset, scire, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 4, 9</bibl></cit>;
