<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 7, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37608.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n37608.3" n="A" level="2"> In a relig. sense, <hi rend="ital">to utter a preliminary prayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to address in prayer beforehand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">majores nostri omnibus rebus agendis Quod bonum, faustum, felix fortunatumque esset, praefabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:45:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 45, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontifice maximo praefante carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 41, 3</bibl></cit>: decemviri carminibus (<case>abl.</case>) praefarentur, <hi rend="ital">should say beforehand</hi> ( = praeirent), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 1, 16</bibl> (v. Weissenb. ad h. l.): priusquam hasce fruges condantur ... ture, vino Jano, Jovi, Junoni praefato, <hi rend="ital">offering wine and incense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">say a prayer to Janus</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 134, 1</bibl>.—With the <hi rend="ital">obj.-acc.</hi> of the deity: <cit><quote lang="la">Janum Jovemque vino praefamino,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 141, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 301</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37608.4" n="B" level="2"> Si dicimus, Ille patrem strangulavit, honorem non praefamur: <cit><quote lang="la">sin de Aureliā aliquid aut Lolliā, honos praefandus est,</quote> <trans><tr>we do not preface it by saying</tr>, <tr>with permission</tr>, <tr>with respect be it spoken</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veniam,</quote> <trans><tr>to ask leave before speaking</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; id. Flor. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n37608.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To name</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cite beforehand</hi>: Aristoteles, quem in iis magnā secuturus ex parte praefandum reor, <hi rend="ital">to mention</hi> or <hi rend="ital">name as an authority in advance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 17, § 43</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37608.6" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To foretell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">predict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophesy</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 383</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n37608.7" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">praefātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif., <hi rend="ital">mentioned</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stated before</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">condemnatus ex praefatis causis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:4:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 20, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:3:19" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 10, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: sic etiam nostro praefatus habebere libro, <hi rend="ital">named at the beginning</hi>, Aus. praef. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine honoribus praefatis appellare aliquid,</quote> <trans><tr>without saying</tr>, <tr>By your leave</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir praefatā reverentiā nominandus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praefātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, for praefatio, <hi rend="ital">a preface</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefato opus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 6:3" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 6, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37608.8" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">praefandus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">for which must be asked</hi> permission or indulgence; <hi rend="ital">that requires apology</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefandi umoris e corpore effluvium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 51, 52, § 171</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praefanda</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">foul expressions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in praefanda videmur incidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeformator: <entryFree id="n37609" type="main" key="praeforma_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeformātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>praeformo</etym>, <sense id="n37609.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that forms</hi> or <hi rend="ital">arranges beforehand</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescript. 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeformido: <entryFree id="n37610" type="main" key="praeformi_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-formīdo</orth>, no <sense id="n37610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to fear beforehand</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 5, 5</bibl> Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (al. perform-, al. reform-), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:608" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 608</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeformo: <entryFree id="n37611" type="main" key="praeformo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-formo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to form</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fashion beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to instruct beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prepare</hi>, etc. (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">his praeformat dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:385" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 385</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut praeformata materia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:6:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeformatae infantibus litterae,</quote> <trans><tr>traced beforehand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 14, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praefortis: <entryFree id="n37612" type="main" key="praefortis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-fortis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very strong</hi> (postclass.; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. infirmus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carn. Chr. 5 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
praefotus: <entryFree id="n37613" type="main" key="praefo_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-fōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [foveo], <sense id="n37613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">warmed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fomented beforehand</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">partes aquā marinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:2" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 2</bibl></cit>. <cb n="PRAE" /></sense></entryFree>
praefracte: <entryFree id="n37614" type="main" key="praefracte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praefractē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. praefringo, <sense id="n37614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praefractus: <entryFree id="n37615" type="main" key="praefractus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praefractus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from praefringo.</entryFree>
praefrigidus: <entryFree id="n37616" type="main" key="praefri_gi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-frīgĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very cold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefrigidus Auster,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:12:35" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 12, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua vel tepida vel praefrigida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:8:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">situs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 20, 34, § 147</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praefringo: <entryFree id="n37617" type="main" key="praefringo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-fringo</orth>, <itype>frēgi, fractum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>frango</etym>, <sense id="n37617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to break off before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at the end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to break to pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shiver</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne caulis praefringatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 33</bibl></cit> (cited by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 20</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">hastas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 10</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">primam aciem telo,</quote> <trans><tr>to break off the point of the missile</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:8:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornu galeae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefracto rostro (triremis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: praefracta strigilis, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:14:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 14, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefracta ligna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:892" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 892</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praefractus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n37617.1" n="A" level="2"> In rhet., <hi rend="ital">broken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abrupt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thucydides praefractior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:13:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 13, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37617.2" n="B" level="2"> In character, <hi rend="ital">stern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harsh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflexible</hi>: Aristo Chius, praefractus, ferreus, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 155, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefractior atque abscissior justitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefractius perseverantiae exemplum,</quote> <trans><tr>sterner</tr>, <tr>firmer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8</bibl></cit>, ext. 3.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praefractē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">sternly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflexibly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resolutely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aerarium defendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:22:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 22, 88</bibl></cit> (<bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 155, 11</bibl>, reads praefractum).—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
praefugio: <entryFree id="n37618" type="main" key="praefu^gi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-fŭgĭo</orth>, <itype>fūgi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n37618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to flee before</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 33 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
praefulcio: <entryFree id="n37619" type="main" key="praefulci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-fulcĭo</orth>, <itype>si, tum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n37619.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To prop up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi> a thing. * </sense><sense id="n37619.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: mollire praefultum torum, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 5, 335.— </sense><sense id="n37619.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum illud praefulci atque praemuni, quaeso, ut simus annui,</quote> <trans><tr>secure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid multis modis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:44" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 44</bibl></cit>: servitus, ubi ego omnibus Parvis magnisque miseriis praefulcior, qs. <hi rend="ital">am propped up</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">surrounded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hedged in by</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 1, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37619.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To place in front as a prop</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stay;</hi> trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">quin me suis negotiis praefulciat,</quote> <trans><tr>use me as a prop</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praefulgeo: <entryFree id="n37620" type="main" key="praefulge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-fulgĕo</orth>, <itype>si, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n37620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to beam</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shine forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shine greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to glitter before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in front of</hi> (rare before the Aug. per.). </sense><sense id="n37620.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitor smaragdi collo praefulget tuo (sc. pavonis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 18, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus praefulgens unguibus aureis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:553" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 553</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitatus phaleris praefulgens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:5:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37620.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: ne splendore praefulgeant, <hi rend="ital">shine</hi> or <hi rend="ital">glitter too much</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 19, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">militarium (rerum) praefulgent nomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:14:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefulgebant Cassius atque Brutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Poppaeus Sabinus consulari decore praefulgens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">enituit et praefulsit decori et honesti dignitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:5:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 5, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praefulgidus: <entryFree id="n37621" type="main" key="praefulgi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-fulgĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very bright</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes caeli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> in Matt. 3, 330, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praefulguro: <entryFree id="n37622" type="main" key="praefulgu^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-fulgŭro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n37622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flash forth</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n37622.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">latus praefulgurat ense,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:502" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 502</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37622.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">strictoque vias praefulgurat ense,</quote> <trans><tr>fills with flashes of light</tr>, <tr>illuminates</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:119" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 119</bibl></cit>: aulam augustam cultu, Coripp. Laud. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:222" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 222</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praefultus: <entryFree id="n37623" type="main" key="praefultus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praefultus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praefulcio.</entryFree>
praefundo: <entryFree id="n37624" type="greek" key="praefundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-fundo</orth>, <itype>fūdi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37624.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pour out before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in addition to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to add by pouring</hi> (post-class.), Simplic. p. 87 Goes.: <cit><quote lang="la">semine cucuminis praefuso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:10:124" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 10, 124</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37624.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To pour upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sprinkle.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37624.2" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pileus vino Calido praefusus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:7:110" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 7, 110</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37624.3" n="2" level="3"> Fig.: <cit><quote lang="la">votis praefusa supplicatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> Ep. 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praefurnium: <entryFree id="n37625" type="main" key="praefurni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praefurnĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>prae-furnus</etym>. <sense id="n37625.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The opening of a furnace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the door</hi> by which fuel is admitted: <cit><quote lang="la">si uno praefurnio coques,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 38, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37625.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The heating-room</hi>, or hot anteroom of a bath, = <foreign lang="greek">propnigei=on</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praefuro: <entryFree id="n37626" type="main" key="praefu^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-fŭro</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n37626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rage violently</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">torvus praefuris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:420" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 420</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 822</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praefuscus: <entryFree id="n37627" type="hapax" key="praefuscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-fuscus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37627.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very swarthy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">black</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 721</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
praegaudeo: <entryFree id="n37628" type="main" key="praegaude^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-gaudĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <sense id="n37628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rejoice greatly;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pelopis sedes adire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:307" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 307</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praegelidus: <entryFree id="n37629" type="main" key="praege^li^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-gĕlĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very cold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in locis praegelidis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiems,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 16, 24, § 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rivi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:226" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 226</bibl></cit>. <cb n="PRAE" /></sense></entryFree>
praegeneratus: <entryFree id="n37630" type="main" key="praege^ne^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-gĕnĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [genero], <sense id="n37630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">generated before</hi> (late Lat.): Prosper Aquit. Epitaph. Haeres. Nestor. et Pelag. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praegermino: <entryFree id="n37631" type="hapax" key="praegermi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-germĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bud forth early</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeflorent talia et praegerminant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 29, 51, § 119</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praegero: <entryFree id="n37632" type="main" key="praege^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-gĕro</orth>, no <sense id="n37632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>gestum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n37632.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carry before</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">speculum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 157, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37632.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To do before;</hi> only <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praegesta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">things done before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">former things</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oblivio praegestorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 5</bibl></cit>, n. 150.</sense></entryFree>
praegestio: <entryFree id="n37633" type="main" key="praegestio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-gestio</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n37633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to desire greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to delight</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">videre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:28:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 28, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 5, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praegestus: <entryFree id="n37634" type="main" key="praegestus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praegestus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from prae, gero.</entryFree>
praegigno: <entryFree id="n37635" type="spur" key="praegigno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-gigno</orth>, <itype>ĕre, a false reading for progigni</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 77</bibl>.</entryFree>
praegloriosus: <entryFree id="n37636" type="gloss" key="praeglo_ri^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-glōrĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37636.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very famous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very glorious</hi> (post-class.); <hi rend="ital">sup</hi>., <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1182</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praegnans: <entryFree id="n37637" type="main" key="praegnans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praegnans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype> (collateral form <orth extent="full" lang="la">praegnas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 95</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 37</bibl>; M. Aurel. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad Caes. 4:6" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad Caes. 4, 6</bibl> Mai; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 105</bibl> et saep.), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>prae- and root gna of gnascor (nascor); cf. gigno</etym>, <sense id="n37637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with child</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pregnant;</hi> of animals, <hi rend="ital">big with young</hi> (class.; syn.: gravidus, fetus). </sense><sense id="n37637.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: gravida est, quae jam gravatur conceptu: praegnans velut occupata in generando, quod conceperit: inciens propinqua partui, quod incitatus sit fetus ejus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=97" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 97</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">uxor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:40:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 40, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere aliquam praegnantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:404" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 404</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 63, 83, § 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 33, 51, § 102</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37637.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37637.3" n="A" level="2"> Of plants: <cit><quote lang="la">praegnas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 32, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surculi praegnates, hoc est, gemmatione turgentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi arborum praegnates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 21, 35, § 155</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of stones: est autem lapis iste praegnans, intus, cum quatias, alio, velut in utero, sonante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 3, 4, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Paeanitides gemmae praegnates fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 10, 66, § 180</bibl></cit>. —Of other things: <cit><quote lang="la">nitrariae praegnates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 10, 46, § 112</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37637.4" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">full of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swollen with</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">praegnas suco herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 15, 80, § 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostrea multo lacte praegnatia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 6, 21, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veneno vipera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 62, § 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cucurbita,</quote> <trans><tr>full</tr>, <tr>swollen</tr>, <tr>large</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:379" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 379</bibl></cit>: stamine fusus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:55" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 55</bibl>.—In the lang. of comedy: <cit><quote lang="la">plagae,</quote> <trans><tr>hard</tr>, <tr>stout</tr>, <tr>smart blows</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praegnas: <entryFree id="n37638" type="main" key="praegnas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praegnas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, v. praegnans <sense id="n37638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praegnatio: <entryFree id="n37639" type="main" key="praegna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praegnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praegnas</etym>, <sense id="n37639.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a getting with child</hi> or <hi rend="ital">with young</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a making pregnant; a being with child</hi> or <hi rend="ital">with young</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pregnancy</hi> (ante- and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n37639.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 106, 21</bibl>.—Of animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37639.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of plants, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:44" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37639.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the cause of fertility</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the universal productiveness of nature</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">o naturarum omnium fecunda praegnatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Trismeg. p. 101, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praegnatus: <entryFree id="n37640" type="main" key="praegna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praegnātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pregnancy</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">juvenculae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praegnaviter: <entryFree id="n37641" type="spur" key="praegna_vi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-gnāvĭter</orth>, <itype>a false reading for prognariter</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 39</bibl>.</entryFree>
praegnax: <entryFree id="n37642" type="hapax" key="praegnax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praegnax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>praegnas</etym>, <sense id="n37642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inclined to pregnancy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praegno: <entryFree id="n37643" type="main" key="praegno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praegno</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n37643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be pregnant</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Dracont.</author> Carm. 10, 577</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praegnātus</orth>, <mood>Part.</mood>, <hi rend="ital">pregnant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Rusp. ad Trasim. 2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praegracilis: <entryFree id="n37644" type="main" key="praegra^ci^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-grăcĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very slender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very lank</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">proceritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 57</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praegrado: <entryFree id="n37645" type="hapax" key="praegra^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praegrădo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>prae-gradus</etym>, <sense id="n37645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precede</hi>, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 65, 3</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 68 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
praegrandis: <entryFree id="n37646" type="main" key="praegrandis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-grandis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very large</hi>, <hi rend="ital">huge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">colossal</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n37646.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">praegrandi gradu, Pac. ap. Fest. s. v. torvitas, p. 355 Müll. (Trag. Rel. p. 67 Rib.): arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 25, 49, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 13, 27, § 95</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 33, 51, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 45, 70, § 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 16, 20, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 74, § 191</bibl></cit>: locusta,<pb n="1421" /> <cb n="PRAE" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:60" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 13, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37646.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">very great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praegrandis senex,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the great Aristophanes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:124" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 124</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praegravidus: <entryFree id="n37647" type="main" key="praegra^vi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-grăvĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very heavy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ponderous</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">moles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:700" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 700</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praegravis: <entryFree id="n37648" type="main" key="praegra^vis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-grăvis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very heavy</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n37648.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">praegrave onus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 21, 32, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:18:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdix feta praegravem aut delumbem esse simulans,</quote> <trans><tr>heavy</tr>, <tr>clumsy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 33, 51, § 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praegravis corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibo vinoque praegraves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 21</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n37648.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">very heavy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppressive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burdensome</hi>: praegraves pavonum greges, i. e. <hi rend="ital">very expensive</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 440, 14</bibl> (al. graves): <cit><quote lang="la">tertium consulatum ut praegravem recusare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:57:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 57, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 8, 6, § 46</bibl></cit>.—Of persons, <hi rend="ital">very wearisome</hi> (Tacitean): <cit><quote lang="la">delatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir principi praegravis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 19</bibl></cit>; 14, 3.</sense></entryFree>
praegravo: <entryFree id="n37649" type="main" key="praegra^vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-grăvo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to press heavily upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to oppress with weight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to encumber</hi> (perh. not before the Aug. period). </sense><sense id="n37649.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">exonerare praegravante turbā regnum cupiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praegravata telis scuta,</quote> <trans><tr>burdened</tr>, <tr>heavy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caper praegravantibus auribus,</quote> <trans><tr>drooping</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37649.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to exceed in weight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preponderate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne praegravet fructus parte aliquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 184</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37649.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to weigh down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depress</hi>: qui praegravat artes, Infra se positas, qs. <hi rend="ital">presses them down by his own superiority</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37649.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To preponderate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cito apparebit, pars civitatis deterior quanto praegravet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:24:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 24, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praegredior: <entryFree id="n37650" type="main" key="praegre^di^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-grĕdĭor</orth>, <itype>gressus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n37650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [gradior] (class.; syn.: praeeo, antecedo). </sense><sense id="n37650.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to go before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in advance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to precede.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37650.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gregi praegreditur equus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37650.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praegredi aliquem pedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non solum nuntios, sed etiam famam adventūs sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 31, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37650.4" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">alios praegredientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37650.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To pass by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go past</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:30:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 30, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37650.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to surpass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Or. ad Caes. 1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Or. ad Caes. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praegressio: <entryFree id="n37651" type="main" key="praegressi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praegressĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praegredior</etym>, <sense id="n37651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preceding.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37651.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">errantium stellarum cursus, praegressiones, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:25:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 25, 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37651.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">precedence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 19, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praegressus: <entryFree id="n37652" type="main" key="praegressus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praegressus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praegredior.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37653" type="main" key="praegressus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praegressus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>praegredior</etym>, <sense id="n37653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going in advance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anticipation</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">anteversio et praegressus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 5, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praegubernans: <entryFree id="n37654" type="main" key="praegu^bernans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-gŭbernans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [guberno], <sense id="n37654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">steering</hi> or <hi rend="ital">guiding forwards</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praegustator: <entryFree id="n37655" type="main" key="praegusta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praegustātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>praegusto</etym>, one who tastes the meats and drinks before they are served at the table of a prince, <sense id="n37655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a foretaster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cup-bearer.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37655.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">DIVI AVGVSTI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 602, 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 582</bibl>.—With private persons, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 626, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37655.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">praegustator libidinum tuarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omnibus nuptiis praegustator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 38, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praegusto: <entryFree id="n37656" type="main" key="praegusto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-gusto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n37656.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To taste beforehand</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">cibos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 4, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 3, 9, § 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:633" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 633</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potum regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:14" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caro bestiis praegustata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:22:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 22, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37656.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to take</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eat</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">drink beforehand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamina, for antidota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:660" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 660</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praegypso: <entryFree id="n37657" type="main" key="praegypso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-gypso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover over with gypsum</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">os vasculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:2" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praehibeo: <entryFree id="n37658" type="main" key="praehi^be^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-hĭbĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype> (old <sense id="n37658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> praehiberier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 4, 2, 7</bibl> Fleck.), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>habeo</etym> (for praebeo, which is a contraction of it), <hi rend="ital">to hold forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supply</hi> (Plautinian): <cit><quote lang="la">vestem, aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui cibum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui operam atque hospitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <trans><tr>to utter</tr>, <tr>speak</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeicio: <entryFree id="n37659" type="main" key="praei^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-ĭcĭo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-jăcĭo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">praejĭcĭo</orth>,<cb n="PRAE" />  Fest. s. v. pone, p. 249 Müll.), <itype>jēci, jactum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37659.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cast</hi> or <hi rend="ital">throw up in front</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n37659.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">moles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n37659.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cast up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">object</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utter reproachfully</hi>: multis in contumeliam Graecorum praejactis probris, Dictys Cret. B. Troj. 2, 24.</sense></entryFree>
praeiens: <entryFree id="n37660" type="main" key="praeiens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-iens</orth>, <itype>euntis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. praeeo <sense id="n37660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praeinfundo: <entryFree id="n37661" type="main" key="praeinfundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-infundo</orth>, <itype>fūdi, fūsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pour into beforehand</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:34" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeinnuo: <entryFree id="n37662" type="hapax" key="praeinnu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-innŭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to indicate beforehand</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 91, 4</bibl> dub. (al. pertimuerint).</sense></entryFree>
praejaceo: <entryFree id="n37663" type="main" key="praeja^ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-jăcĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n37663.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lie before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be situated in front of</hi> any thing (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n37663.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vastum mare praejacens Asiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 24, § 75</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37663.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">campus qui castra praejacet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 36</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n37663.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">praejacentibus stagnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praejacio: <entryFree id="n37664" type="main" key="praeja^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-jăcĭo</orth>, v. praeicio.</entryFree>
praejactito: <entryFree id="n37665" type="main" key="praejacti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praejactĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to boast excessively</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 36, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praejactus: <entryFree id="n37666" type="main" key="praejactus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-jactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praejacio.</entryFree>
praejicio: <entryFree id="n37667" type="main" key="praeji^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-jĭcĭo</orth>, v. praeicio <sense id="n37667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praejudex: <entryFree id="n37668" type="gloss" key="praeju_dex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-jūdex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n37668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who judges beforehand</hi>: praejudex, <foreign lang="greek">prodikasth/s</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
praejudicatum: <entryFree id="n37669" type="main" key="praeju_di^ca_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praejūdĭcātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. praejudico, <sense id="n37669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praejudicatus: <entryFree id="n37670" type="main" key="praeju_di^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praejūdĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from praejudico.</entryFree>
praejudicialis: <entryFree id="n37671" type="main" key="praeju_di^ci^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praejūdĭcĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n37671.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Belonging</hi> or <hi rend="ital">according to a preceding judgment</hi> or <hi rend="ital">decision</hi> (post-class.): multam, Cod. Th. 11, 30, 50; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 10:51" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 10, 51</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37671.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a preceding examination</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">actiones ( = praejudicia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 4:6:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 4, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:44:94" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 44, 94</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praejudicium: <entryFree id="n37672" type="main" key="praeju_di^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-jūdĭcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n37672.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a preceding judgment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sentence</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">decision</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a precedent</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">praejudiciorum vis omnis tribus in generibus versatur: rebus, quae aliquando ex paribus causis sunt judicatae, quae exempla rectius dicuntur: judiciis ad ipsam causam pertinentibus: unde etiam nomen ductum est: aut cum de eādem causā pronuntiatum est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:2:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de quo non praejudicium, sed plane judicium jam factum putatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 4, 12</bibl></cit> (praejudicium dicitur res, quae cum statuta fuerit, affert judicaturis exemplum, quod sequantur: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium autem res, quae causam litemque determinat, Ascon.): apud eosdem judices reus est factus, cum is duobus praejudiciis jam damnatus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:22:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 22, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praejudicium a se de capite C. Verris per hoc judicium nolle fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:65:section=152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 65, § 152</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:28:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 28, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:20:59 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 20, 59 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cicero pro Milone non ante narravit, quam praejudiciis omnibus reum liberavit,</quote> <trans><tr>from all preceding judgments</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:5:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postulavit, ne cognitioni Caesaris praejudicium fieret,</quote> <trans><tr>preceding judgment</tr>, <tr>precedent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 6, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37672.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37672.2" n="A" level="2"> Any thing that precedes another thing in such manner that we can judge or conclude from it what is further to happen, <hi rend="ital">a precedent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">example</hi>: Pompeius nullo proelio pulsus, vestri facti praejudicio demotus Italiā excessit, <hi rend="ital">by the example of your conduct</hi> (which he feared would be imitated), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">an Africi belli praejudicia sequimini?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orabat ut se praejudicio juvarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statim quaestor ejus in praejudicium aliquot criminibus arreptus est,</quote> <trans><tr>as an example of what was to happen to himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37672.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A damage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disadvantage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prejudice</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">praejudicium in patrem quaeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:35:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 35, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">absque praejudicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:2:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim alimentorum causa veritati facit praejudicium,</quote> <trans><tr>does no harm</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:6:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine ullo litis praejudicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:2:27" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 26, 2, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Tim. 5, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37672.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A judicial examination previous to a trial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoties de hoc contenditur, an quis libertus sit, etc., ... redditur praejudicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:14:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 14, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patronus in praejudicio possessor esse videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:3:18" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 22, 3, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37672.5" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A decision made beforehand</hi> or <hi rend="ital">before the proper time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neminem praejudicium rei tantae afferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praejudico: <entryFree id="n37673" type="main" key="praeju_di^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-jūdĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to judge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass sentence</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">decide beforehand</hi>, <cb n="PRAE" /> <hi rend="ital">to prejudge</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n37673.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, in the judicial sphere: <cit><quote lang="la">praejudicare de aliquo majore maleficio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:20:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 20, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:65:section=153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 65, § 153</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37673.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, apart from judicial lang.: de iis censores praejudicent, <hi rend="ital">let the censors give their preliminary judgment</hi> (before the case is brought before the judges), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:20:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 20, 47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37673.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be injurious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prejudicial;</hi> with <case>dat.</case> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">res inter alios judicatae aliis non praejudicant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1:63" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 1, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:7" default="NO">47, 10, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenuitati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 3, 41</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praejūdĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">decided beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prejudged</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praejudicatum eventum belli habetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:17:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 17, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 44, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinio,</quote> <trans><tr>a preconceived notion</tr>, <tr>prejudice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:5:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 5, 10</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir praejudicatissimus,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>whose talents are already clearly ascertained</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> post Carm. 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37673.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praejūdĭ-cātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n37673.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Something decided beforehand</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37673.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A previous opinion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prepossession</hi>, = praejudicium postulo, ut ne quid huc praejudicati afferatis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 2, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praejuratio: <entryFree id="n37674" type="gloss" key="praeju_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-jūrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n37674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a previous taking of an oath</hi> which others then repeat: <cit><quote lang="la">praejurationes facere dicuntur hi, qui ante alios conceptis verbis jurant: post quos eadem verba jurantes tantummodo dicunt: Idem in me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=224" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 224</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
praejuvo: <entryFree id="n37675" type="main" key="praeju^vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-jŭvo</orth>, <itype>jūvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to aid before</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">affectam ejus fidem praejuvisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 65</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praelabor: <entryFree id="n37676" type="main" key="praela_bor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-lābor</orth>, <itype>lapsus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n37676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to glide onwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swim</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">along; to move</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glide</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">quickly by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">past</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n37676.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">insula, in quam Germani nando praelabebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscis praelabitur ante, Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 43, 111: amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:355" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 355</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rotis flumina,</quote> <trans><tr>to glide by the streams on wheels</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 180</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ales bestiam praevenit et secundo flatu praelabitur et anticipat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Soc. prol. p. 365, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37676.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to glide past</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hasten by</hi> a thing; with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira eruditas mentes praelabitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praelabens tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praelambo: <entryFree id="n37677" type="main" key="praelambo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-lambo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lick</hi> or <hi rend="ital">taste beforehand</hi> or <hi rend="ital">first</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n37677.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(mus) praelambens omne, quod affert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 109</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37677.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to wash</hi> or <hi rend="ital">touch lightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bathe gently</hi>, of a river that flows by a place: <cit><quote lang="la">arenas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Hamart. 357</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 494</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praelapsus: <entryFree id="n37678" type="main" key="praelapsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praelapsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praelabor.</entryFree>
praelargus: <entryFree id="n37679" type="main" key="praelargus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-largus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very copious</hi> or <hi rend="ital">abundant</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">pulmo animae praelargus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:14" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dapes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 3, 754</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praelassatus: <entryFree id="n37680" type="hapax" key="praelassa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-lassātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [lasso], <sense id="n37680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wearied beforehand</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praelatio: <entryFree id="n37681" type="main" key="praela_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praelātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praefero</etym>, <sense id="n37681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a preferring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a preference</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:8:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Uxor. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Jacob, 2, 2, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praelator: <entryFree id="n37682" type="main" key="praela_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praelātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that prefers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a preferrer</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">misericordiae praelator quam sacrificii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pudic. 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praelatus: <entryFree id="n37683" type="main" key="praela_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praelātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praefero.</entryFree>
praelautus: <entryFree id="n37684" type="main" key="praelautus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-lautus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very elegant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sumptuous</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">luxurious</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vitell. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praelavo: <entryFree id="n37685" type="main" key="praela^vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-lăvo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wash</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rinse beforehand</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 278 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cinis praelavatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praelaxatus: <entryFree id="n37686" type="main" key="praelaxa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-laxātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [laxo], <sense id="n37686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">widened</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relieved beforehand</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1:27" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praelectio: <entryFree id="n37687" type="main" key="praelecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praelectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. praelego</etym>, <sense id="n37687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reading aloud to others</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lecture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prelection</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:4" default="NO">2, 5, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praelector: <entryFree id="n37688" type="main" key="praelector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praelector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who reads an author to others and adds explanations</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a prelector</hi> (post-class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lector, recitator),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:5:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praelectus: <entryFree id="n37689" type="main" key="praelectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praelectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 2. praelego.</entryFree>
praelego: <entryFree id="n37690" type="main" key="praele_go1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-lēgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bequeath beforehand</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to bequeath</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">to be given before the inheritance is divided</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">eam coronam testamento ei praelegavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 2, 11, § 38</bibl></cit>: peculia <pb n="1422" /> <cb n="PRAE" /> filiis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:8:26" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 8, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:1:69" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 31, 1, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxori dotem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37691" type="main" key="praele^go2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-lĕgo</orth>, <itype>lēgi, lectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n37691.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To read</hi> any thing <hi rend="ital">to others</hi>, as a teacher, to show how it should be read, <hi rend="ital">to set an example in reading</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lecture upon</hi> an author (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">auctores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vergilium et alios poëtas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37691.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To pick</hi> or <hi rend="ital">choose out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to select</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">praelectus hircus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 192, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37691.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To sail by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">along</hi> a place (post-Aug. for praetervehor); with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Campaniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 79</bibl> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: Alsia praelegitur tellus, <hi rend="ital">is sailed by</hi>, Rut. Itin. 1, 223.</sense></entryFree>
praelialis: <entryFree id="n37692" type="main" key="praeli^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praelĭālis</orth>, v. proelialis.</entryFree>
praeliator: <entryFree id="n37693" type="main" key="praeli^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praelĭātor</orth>, v. proeliator.</entryFree>
praelibatio: <entryFree id="n37694" type="main" key="praeli_ba_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praelībātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praelibo</etym>, <sense id="n37694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tasting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">taking away beforehand</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n37694.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an offering of the first-fruits</hi>: praemetium, quod praelibationis causā ante praemetitur, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. praemetium, p. 235 Müll.: labiorum, <hi rend="ital">a slight touch of the lips</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a gentle kiss</hi>, Ambros. Isaac et Anim. 3, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n37694.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a lessening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diminution</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeliber: <entryFree id="n37695" type="main" key="praeli_ber"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-līber</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very</hi> or <hi rend="ital">entirely free</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 155</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praelibo: <entryFree id="n37696" type="main" key="praeli_bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-lībo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n37696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v.a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to taste beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foretaste</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n37696.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nectar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:4:60" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 4, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37696.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus ac pectora Ulysses Praelibat visu,</quote> <trans><tr>examines</tr>, <tr>inspects</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 2, 88</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praelicenter: <entryFree id="n37697" type="main" key="praeli^center"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-lĭcenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n37697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">too freely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">too boldly</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">verba finxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:7:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disponens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeligamen: <entryFree id="n37698" type="main" key="praeli^ga_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praelĭgāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>praeligo</etym>, <sense id="n37698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">something bound on in front</hi> or <hi rend="ital">about one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an amulet</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeliganeus: <entryFree id="n37699" type="main" key="praeli^ga_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praelĭgānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. praelego</etym>, <sense id="n37699.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">picked beforehand</hi>: vinum, <hi rend="ital">a poor kind of wine made of unripe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bad grapes gathered before the vintage</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 23, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeligo: <entryFree id="n37700" type="main" key="praeli^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-lĭgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n37700.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bind on before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arida sarmenta praeligantur cornibus boum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cauda pecoris quam arctissime praeligata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:38" default="NO"
