valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 2, 10, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salice marginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 109</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37700.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bind around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tie about</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">statuae coronam candida fascia praeligatam imponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:79" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars palmitis praeligata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linum, quo praeligata infra caput vipera pependerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 5, 12, § 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37700.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37700.3" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To bind up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tie up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">os praeligatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:50:149" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 50, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera nodo Herculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 6, 17, § 63</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37700.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To cover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">veil</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestibus capita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 102, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37700.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fetter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charm</hi>: o praeligatum pectus! <hi rend="ital">bound up</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">obdurate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praelino: <entryFree id="n37701" type="main" key="praeli^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-lĭno</orth>, no <sense id="n37701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>lĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to smear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">daub in front</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to plaster over</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum fucatur atque praelinitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:14:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 14, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">villas tectorio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:23:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 23, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praelitus: <entryFree id="n37702" type="main" key="praeli^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praelĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praelino.</entryFree>
praelium: <entryFree id="n37703" type="main" key="praeli^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praelĭum, praeliāris, praeliā-tor</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">praelĭor</orth>, v. proel.</entryFree>
praeloco: <entryFree id="n37704" type="main" key="praelo^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-lŏco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to set</hi> or <hi rend="ital">place before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to put first</hi> or <hi rend="ital">foremost</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">si pro trochaeo paenultimo spondeum praelocaveris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 522</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Gen. ad Lit. 7:17" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Gen. ad Lit. 7, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consonans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Syll. p. 2390</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praelocutio: <entryFree id="n37705" type="main" key="praelo^cu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praelŏcūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praeloquor</etym>, <sense id="n37705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a speaking before.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37705.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Excerpt. Contr. 3 praef" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Excerpt. Contr. 3 praef.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n37705.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a preface</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preamble</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Doctr. Chr. 4:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Doctr. Chr. 4, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praelocutus: <entryFree id="n37706" type="main" key="praelo^cu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praelŏcūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praeloquor.</entryFree>
praelongo: <entryFree id="n37707" type="main" key="praelongo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praelongo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>praelongus</etym>, <sense id="n37707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lengthen out very much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make very long</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">pedum crura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 2, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praelongus: <entryFree id="n37708" type="main" key="praelongus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-longus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very long</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>very tall</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cauda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 33, 51, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gracilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 46</bibl></cit>.—Of time, <hi rend="ital">very long</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeloquor: <entryFree id="n37709" type="main" key="praelo^quor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-lŏquor</orth>, <itype>cūtus</itype> (quūtus), 3, <sense id="n37709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> and <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n37709.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To speak beforehand</hi> or <hi rend="ital">first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to speak before another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to forestall in speaking</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">occupas praeloqui, quae mi'st oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod mihi causam praeloquendi dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 21, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37709.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To say beforehand</hi>, in the way of preface or introduction, <hi rend="ital">to premise</hi>, Quint. <cb n="PRAE" /> 4, 1, 2.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libri amplitudo non sinit me longiore epistulā praeloqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37709.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To foretell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">predict</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Epit. 47, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeluceo: <entryFree id="n37710" type="main" key="praelu_ceo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-lūceo</orth>, <itype>xi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <sense id="n37710.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To shine</hi> or <hi rend="ital">give light before; to hold</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carry a light before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to light.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37710.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37710.2" n="1" level="3"> Of those who carry a light: <cit><quote lang="la">servus praelucens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:89" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 89</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37710.3" n="2" level="3"> Of the light itself: <cit><quote lang="la">praeluxere faces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:42:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 42, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ignis noster praeluceat facinori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 11, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37710.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37710.5" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to shine forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be bright</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitia bonā spe praelucet in posterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 7, 23</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumenque tuae praeluceo vitae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 4, 95</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37710.6" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to shine brighter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to outshine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surpass</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullus sinus Baiis praelucet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 83</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n37710.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To shine very much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shine brightly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">baculum praelucet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 52, § 141</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praelucidus: <entryFree id="n37711" type="main" key="praelu_ci^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-lūcĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shining greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very bright</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">candor circuli praelucidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 6, 23, § 88</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeludo: <entryFree id="n37712" type="main" key="praelu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-lūdo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to play beforehand</hi>, by way of practice or trial; <hi rend="ital">to prelude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rehearse</hi> (post - Aug.). </sense><sense id="n37712.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nero Pompeiano praeludit,</quote> <trans><tr>sings beforehand</tr>, <tr>preludes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 7, § 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tragoediis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:11:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 11, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: pugnam praeludere, <hi rend="ital">to prepare one's self for fighting</hi>, Rut. Itin. 1, 257.—</sense><sense id="n37712.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid operibus suis praeludere,</quote> <trans><tr>to premise</tr>, <tr>preface</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1 praef" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1 praef.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac Mariana quidem rabies intra Urbem praeluserat, quasi experiretur,</quote> <trans><tr>had only made a prelude</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic maria bello quasi tempestate praeluserant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:6:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praelum: <entryFree id="n37713" type="main" key="praelum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praelum</orth>, v. prelum.</entryFree>
praelumbo: <entryFree id="n37714" type="main" key="praelumbo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praelumbo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>prae - lumbus</etym>, <sense id="n37714.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make lame in the loins</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hipshot</hi> (anteclass.), Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 156, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeluminatus: <entryFree id="n37715" type="main" key="praelu_mi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-lūmĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [lumino], <sense id="n37715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">illustrated</hi> or <hi rend="ital">explained before</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praelusio: <entryFree id="n37716" type="main" key="praelu_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praelūsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praeludo</etym>, <sense id="n37716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prelude</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">praelusio atque praecursio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 13, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praelustris: <entryFree id="n37717" type="main" key="praelustris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-lustris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. lustro</etym>, <sense id="n37717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very illustrious</hi> or <hi rend="ital">magnificent</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">praelustria vita,</quote> <trans><tr>shun worldly grandeur</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:5" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praemacero: <entryFree id="n37718" type="main" key="praema_ce^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-mācĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to soak</hi> or <hi rend="ital">steep beforehand</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mala cydonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 193" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 193</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praemaledico: <entryFree id="n37719" type="main" key="praema^le^di_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-mălĕdīco</orth>, <itype>xi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to curse beforehand</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praemando: <entryFree id="n37720" type="main" key="praemando1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-mando</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n37720.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To order</hi> or <hi rend="ital">command beforehand;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> (very rare): ut conquireretur, praemandavi, Vatin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 9, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37720.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To order</hi> or <hi rend="ital">procure beforehand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerum aut puellam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 49</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praemandāta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a warrant</hi> for the apprehension of an accused person: <cit><quote lang="la">emissus e carcere: idem postea praemandatis requisitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 12, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37721" type="main" key="praemando2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-mando</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37721.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to chew beforehand;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">to explain accurately and clearly</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:1:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praemature: <entryFree id="n37722" type="main" key="praema_tu_re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praemātūrē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. praematurus.</entryFree>
praematurus: <entryFree id="n37723" type="main" key="praema_tu_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-mātūrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n37723.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Very early</hi>, <hi rend="ital">early</hi> (syn. praecox): <cit><quote lang="la">fructus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:51" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37723.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Too early</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untimely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">premature</hi>: denuntiatio, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 51, 52, § 171</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cineres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:44" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiems,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canities,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 57</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">neutr. sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">castrari agnos, nisi quinquemestres, praematurum existimatur,</quote> <trans><tr>is thought too early</tr>, <tr>premature</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 75, § 198</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praemātūrē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">too soon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untimely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prematurely</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">praemature vitā careo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum significandum est coactius quid factum, et festinatius, tum rectius praemature factum id dicitur, quam mature,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:11:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 11, 8</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praematurius agi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:118" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 1, 118</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praemedicatus: <entryFree id="n37724" type="main" key="praeme^di^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-mĕdĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [medico], <sense id="n37724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">protected by medicines</hi> or <hi rend="ital">charms</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>, and eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Aesonides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antidoto praemedicatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Jejun. 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praemeditatio: <entryFree id="n37725" type="main" key="praeme^di^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praemĕdĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praemeditor</etym>, <sense id="n37725.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a considering beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">premeditation</hi> (used by Cic.): futurorum malorum, <cb n="PRAE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:14:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 14, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diuturna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 15, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">futuri regni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Matt. 3, 17, v. 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praemeditatorium: <entryFree id="n37726" type="main" key="praeme^di^ta_to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praemĕdĭtātōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>praemeditor</etym>, <sense id="n37726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place for preparation</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Jejun. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praemeditor: <entryFree id="n37727" type="main" key="praeme^di^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-mĕdĭtor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n37727.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to think over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to muse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">deliberate upon beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to premeditate</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n37727.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">object - clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemeditari id ferendum modice esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37727.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">relative - clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemeditari, quo animo accedam ad Urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 5, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37727.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tentans citharam et praemeditans,</quote> <trans><tr>preluding</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 15</bibl></cit>. —Hence, in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praemĕdĭtā-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">previously considered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">premeditated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala praemeditata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:15:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 15, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil cogitati praemeditatique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:3" default="NO">5, 13, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praemercor: <entryFree id="n37728" type="main" key="praemercor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-mercor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n37728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to buy before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beforehand</hi> (ante - class.): <cit><quote lang="la">praemercatur ancillam senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:Arg. 2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. Arg. 2, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 25</bibl>: ni pretio minus parcerent, eaque praemercarentur, <hi rend="ital">should forestall the markets</hi>, Cass. Hem. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 10, § 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praemessum: <entryFree id="n37729" type="main" key="praemessum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praemessum</orth>, v. praemetium.</entryFree>
praemetium: <entryFree id="n37730" type="gloss" key="praeme^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praemĕtĭum</orth> (al. ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">praemessum</orth>), <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>prae-metior</etym>, <sense id="n37730.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the offering of the firstfruits measured out beforehand for Ceres</hi>: praemetium quod praelibationis causā ante praemetitur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=235" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 235</bibl> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praemetium de spicis, quas primum messuissent, sacrificabant Cereri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> s. v. sacrima, p. 319 ib.; and: praemetium (al. praemetivum), <foreign lang="greek">h( pro\ qerismou= *dhmh/tras qusi/a</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
praemetor: <entryFree id="n37731" type="main" key="praeme_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-mētor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n37731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to measure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">measure out beforehand</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 40</bibl> (dub.; al. metatum).—Hence, in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praemētātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">measured</hi> or <hi rend="ital">meted out beforehand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemetata divūm itinera,</quote> <trans><tr>predestined</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 811</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praemetuens: <entryFree id="n37732" type="main" key="praeme^tu^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praemĕtŭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from praemetuo.</entryFree>
praemetuenter: <entryFree id="n37733" type="main" key="praeme^tu^enter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-mĕtŭenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. praemetuo, <sense id="n37733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praemetuo: <entryFree id="n37734" type="main" key="praeme^tu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-mĕtŭo</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n37734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37734.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">be in fear beforehand</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1019" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1019</bibl></cit>: Caesar praemetuens suis, <hi rend="ital">fearing for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anxious about his men</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:49:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 49, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37734.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fear</hi> something <hi rend="ital">beforehand</hi>: poenas Danaum et deserti conjugis iras, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:573" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 573</bibl>: dum praemetuit cultus inolescere Christi, Prud. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:681" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> 2, 681</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praemĕtŭ-ens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">fearing beforehand;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ovis praemetuens doli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 16, 4</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praemĕtŭenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">anxiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solicitously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">errorem vitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:823" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 823</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praemialis: <entryFree id="n37735" type="main" key="praemi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praemĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>praemium</etym>, <sense id="n37735.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">used as a reward</hi> (eccl. Lat.): resurrectio, Aug. c. Sec. Resp. Jul. 6, 36.</sense></entryFree>
praemiator: <entryFree id="n37736" type="main" key="praemi^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praemĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>praemior</etym>. <sense id="n37736.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A robber</hi> (ante-class.), Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 150, 23</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 6 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n37736.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A rewarder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one who gives a reward to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luctantium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 36, 57</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praemiatrix: <entryFree id="n37737" type="main" key="praemi^a_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praemĭātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praemiator</etym>, <sense id="n37737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who rewards</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum praemiatrix Adrastia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 11, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praemico: <entryFree id="n37738" type="main" key="praemi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-mĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n37738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to gleam</hi> or <hi rend="ital">glitter forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to glitter very much</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">lucerna claro lumine praemicans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 167, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemicantis lunae candor nimius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl></cit>, p. 257 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">galea nitore praemicans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl></cit>, p. 238; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 1, 84.</sense></entryFree>
praemigro: <entryFree id="n37739" type="main" key="praemi_^gro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-mī^gro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n37739.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to move away beforehand</hi> or <hi rend="ital">before</hi> (post - Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ruinis imminentibus musculi praemigrant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8</bibl></cit> 28, 42, § 103.</sense></entryFree>
praemineo: <entryFree id="n37740" type="main" key="praemi^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praemĭnĕo</orth>, v. praeemineo.</entryFree>
praeminister: <entryFree id="n37741" type="main" key="praemi^nister"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-mĭnister</orth>, <itype>tri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n37741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a servant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an attendant</hi> (post - class.): <cit><quote lang="la">deorum ... flaminum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Or. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeministra: <entryFree id="n37742" type="main" key="praemi^nistra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-mĭnistra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n37742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female attendant</hi> or <hi rend="ital">minister</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">lingua mendaciorum et amaritudinum praeministra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 278, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeministro: <entryFree id="n37743" type="main" key="praemi^nistro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-mĭnistro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n37743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37743.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wait</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attend upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to minister to</hi> any one (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">magistratibus,</quote> <trans><tr>of the lictors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:3:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 3, 13</bibl>: alicui,<pb n="1423" /> <cb n="PRAE" />  <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 160, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37743.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to furnish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hand to</hi> any one: <cit><quote lang="la">ac praeministrasse modulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 11, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Bapt. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabulas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Apol. 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeminor: <entryFree id="n37744" type="main" key="praemi^nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-mĭnor</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n37744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to threaten beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to threaten greatly</hi> (post-class.); with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 167, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8</bibl>, p. 211, 11: <cit><quote lang="la">haec illis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praemior: <entryFree id="n37745" type="main" key="praemi^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praemĭor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>praemium</etym>, <sense id="n37745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stipulate for a reward</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">constabat, in cognitionibus patriis nundinari praemiarique solitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 7</bibl></cit>: sequimini me, praemiati, Nov. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=464" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 464</bibl> Müll. (Com. Rel. p. 217 Rib. ex conject.).</sense></entryFree>
praemiosus: <entryFree id="n37746" type="main" key="praemi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praemĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37746.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rich</hi> (ante-class.): praemiosam, pecuniosam, dixit <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, Fest. p. 242</bibl> Müll.; cf.: praemiosa, pecuniosa, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=243" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 243</bibl> ib.</sense></entryFree>
praemissa: <entryFree id="n37747" type="main" key="praemissa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praemissa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. praemitto <sense id="n37747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praemissus: <entryFree id="n37748" type="main" key="praemissus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praemissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praemitto.</entryFree>
praemistus: <entryFree id="n37749" type="main" key="praemistus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praemistus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">praemixtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [misceo], <sense id="n37749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mixed beforehand</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">praemixta olera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:5" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:3:63" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 3, 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praemitis: <entryFree id="n37750" type="main" key="praemi_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-mītis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very gentle</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">asina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 3, 633</bibl></cit>; Ven. Fort. Carm. 3, 12, 37.</sense></entryFree>
praemitto: <entryFree id="n37751" type="main" key="praemitto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-mitto</orth>, <itype>mīsi, missum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to send forward</hi> or <hi rend="ital">before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to despatch in advance.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37751.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">a portu me praemisisti domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones in Hispaniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatum ad flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 52:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 52, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petebant uti ad eos equites praemitteret, sc. nuntios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 20, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">edictum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 19, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 24, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">odiosas litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc Acheruntem praemittam prius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37751.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to set before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in front</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficetis caprificus praemittitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 19, 21, § 80</bibl></cit> (dub.; al. permittitur).—</sense><sense id="n37751.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to send out in advance</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">cervicem gladio caesim graviter percussit, praemissā voce: Hoc age,</quote> <trans><tr>saying first</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:58" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam haec favorabili oratione praemisit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Am. 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitationes in longinqua praemittimus,</quote> <trans><tr>send our thoughts into the distance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 5:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 5, 7</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praemissa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">things sent in advance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the first - fruits</hi>, = primitiae (postAug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 1, 2, § 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praemium: <entryFree id="n37752" type="main" key="praemi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praemĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>prae-emo, what one has got before or better than others</etym> (class.). <sense id="n37752.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Profit derived from booty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">booty</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; cf. praeda; and: avorti praedam ab hostibus. <hi rend="ital">Pen.</hi> Heus, ecqua in istac pars inest praemi mihi? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 26</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">multaque praeterea Laurentis praemia pugnae Aggerat, et longo praedam jubet ordine duci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:78 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 78 sq.</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">rapta praemia veste ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:25" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferre ad patrios praemia dira Lares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:23:67" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 23, 67</bibl></cit> (3, 28, 22): <cit><quote lang="la">spectat sua praemia raptor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:518" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 518</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 414</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam dirae praemia culpae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:119" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 119</bibl></cit>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">game killed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prey</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 11</bibl> (4, 12), 46; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:36" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:253" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 253</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">raptae virginitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:850" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 850</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37752.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37752.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">profit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advantage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prerogative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinction</hi> (class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:899" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 899</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:956" default="NO" valid="yes">956</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 5</bibl>; cf. <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: Veneris, i. e. <hi rend="ital">children</hi> (the Greek <foreign lang="greek">dw=ra *)afrodi/ths</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">absens factus aedilis, continuo praetor: licebat enim celerius legis praemio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37752.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">reward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recompense</hi> (the predom. signif. of the word; syn.: munus, donum): sapiens virtuti honorem praemium, haud praedam petit, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:26:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 26, 102</bibl> (Trag. v. 374 Vahl.): ecquid erit praemi, <hi rend="ital">reward</hi>, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 1, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 341 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">donum et praemium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legibus praemia proposita sunt virtutibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">persuadere alicui magnis praemiis et pollicitationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemiis ad perdiscendum commoveri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemia alicui dare pro re aliquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemio afficere aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>to reward</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">augere, Tac A. 1, 42: inducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 13, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 97:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 97, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elicere ad faciendum aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:chapter=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">evocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemium persolvere alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to give</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:29:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 29, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reddere alicui pro re aliquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rependere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:50" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proponere,</quote> <trans><tr>to propose</tr>, <tr>offer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: consequi, <hi rend="ital">to obtain</hi>,<cb n="PRAE" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 42</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:321" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 321</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promittens, si sibi praemio foret, se Arpos proditurum esse,</quote> <trans><tr>if he were rewarded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 45</bibl></cit>.—Ironic.: cape praemia facti, <hi rend="ital">reward</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">punishment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:503" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 503</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi pro scelere, Di ... praemia reddant Debita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:537" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 537</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37752.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A bribe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut somno careas ponendaque praemia sumas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:56" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37752.5" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an act deserving a reward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an exploit</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 437</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praemixtus: <entryFree id="n37753" type="main" key="praemixtus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praemixtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. praemistus.</entryFree>
praemoderans: <entryFree id="n37754" type="main" key="praemo^de^rans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-mŏdĕrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [moderor], <sense id="n37754.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">prescribing a measure</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in proelia ingredi praemoderante citharā gressibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 11, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praemodulatus: <entryFree id="n37755" type="main" key="praemo^du^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-mŏdŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [modulor], <sense id="n37755.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">measured out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">modulated beforehand</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">cogitationem gestu,</quote> <trans><tr>to adapt the thoughts beforehand to the gestures</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:109" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 109</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praemodum: <entryFree id="n37756" type="main" key="praemo^dum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praemŏdum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>prae-modus</etym>, <sense id="n37756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">beyond measure</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Livius in Odysseā praemodum dicit, quasi admodum Parcentes, inquit, praemodum: quod significat supra modum: dictumque est quasi praeter modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:7:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 7, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praemoenio: <entryFree id="n37757" type="main" key="praemoenio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-moenio</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, v. praemunio.</entryFree>
praemolestia: <entryFree id="n37758" type="hapax" key="praemo^lesti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-mŏlestĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n37758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">trouble beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anxiety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apprehension;</hi> another term for metus: <cit><quote lang="la">alii metum praemolestiam appellabant, quod est quasi dux consequentis molestiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:30:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 30, 64</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praemolior: <entryFree id="n37759" type="main" key="praemo_li^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-mōlĭor</orth>, <itype>īri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n37759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to prepare</hi> or <hi rend="ital">make preparations for beforehand</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 17, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praemollio: <entryFree id="n37760" type="main" key="praemolli^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-mollĭo</orth>, no <sense id="n37760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to soften beforehand</hi> (post - Aug.). </sense><sense id="n37760.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemollitus sulcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:9:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:3" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37760.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to soften</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mollify beforehand</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicum mentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:5:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 5, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praemollis: <entryFree id="n37761" type="main" key="praemollis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-mollis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very soft</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ova,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 51, 75, § 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">involucrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 69, § 181</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praemoneo: <entryFree id="n37762" type="main" key="praemo^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-mŏnĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n37762.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to forewarn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to advise</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">admonish beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to remind beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to premonish</hi> (class.); constr. <hi rend="ital">aliquem</hi> with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, with a simple <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi> (of a thing): <cit><quote lang="la">me, ut magnopere caverem, praemonebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 8, 23</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:57:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 57, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut te praemonerem, plurimum tibi credas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 22, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemonito filio, ne alii crederet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:14:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 14, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemoneo, numquam scripta quod ista legat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:1:16" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de impendentibus periculis voce Jovis praemoneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conatus hostis,</quote> <trans><tr>to warn of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:20:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 20, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli varietatem praemonitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemoniti oraculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 39, 76, § 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut futuri principes praemonerentur, quā viā possent ad gloriam niti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 18, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37762.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., of prophecies, <hi rend="ital">to foretell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foreshow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">predict</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">futura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:1:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 43, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haruspices praemonuerunt superna vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 56, 57, § 147</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37762.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Of inanimate things, <hi rend="ital">to presage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">signify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foreshadow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferunt Terribiles tubas auditaque cornua caelo Praemonuisse nefas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:784" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 784</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rutilus (circa lunam) et ventos et imbres praemonebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 79, § 347</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37762.3" n="(g)" level="5"> Of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">pericula (animalia) praemonent, non fibris modo extisque, sed aliā quādam significatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 28, 42, § 102</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37762.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et vatum timeo monitus, quos, igne Pelasgo Ilion arsuram, praemonuisse ferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 239</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praemŏnĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a premonition</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">praemonita et praecepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praemonitio: <entryFree id="n37763" type="main" key="praemo^ni^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praemŏnĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praemoneo</etym>, <sense id="n37763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a forewarning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">premonition</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praemonitor: <entryFree id="n37764" type="main" key="praemo^ni^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praemŏnĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a forewarner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">premonitor</hi> (post - class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 51, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praemonitorius: <entryFree id="n37765" type="main" key="praemo^ni^to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praemŏnĭtōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>praemonitor</etym>, <sense id="n37765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that gives previous warning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">premonitory</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">edictum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praemonitum: <entryFree id="n37766" type="main" key="praemo^ni^tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praemŏnĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. praemoneo <sense id="n37766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praemonitus: <entryFree id="n37767" type="main" key="praemo^ni^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praemŏnĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praemoneo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37768" type="main" key="praemo^ni^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praemŏnĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>praemoneo</etym>, <sense id="n37768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a forewarning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">premonition</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">deūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:800" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 800</bibl></cit>. <cb n="PRAE" /></sense></entryFree>
praemonstratio: <entryFree id="n37769" type="main" key="praemonstra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praemonstrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praemonstro</etym>, <sense id="n37769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a showing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">indicating beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a premonstration</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 14, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praemonstrator: <entryFree id="n37770" type="hapax" key="praemonstra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praemonstrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n37770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who shows</hi> or <hi rend="ital">points out beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a guide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">director</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">monitor et praemonstrator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praemonstro: <entryFree id="n37771" type="main" key="praemonstro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-monstro</orth> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">praemo-stro</orth>, <sense id="n37771.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to show beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to point out the way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to guide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">direct.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37771.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">praemonstra docte, quid fabuletur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currenti spatium praemonstra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te praemonstrante,</quote> <trans><tr>under thy guidance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:66" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemostro tibi, ut,</quote> <trans><tr>I caution you</tr>, <tr>that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 61</bibl></cit> Brix ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae voluit mihi dixit, docuit et praemonstravit prius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37771.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to denote beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to predict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">presage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prognosticate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum aliquid populo Romano praemonstrare et praecinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 10, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventos futuros, id. poët. Div. 1, 7, 13: hanc suavitatem praemonstratam efficaci auspicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 43, § 82</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praemordeo: <entryFree id="n37772" type="main" key="praemorde^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-mordĕo</orth>, <itype>morsi and mordi, morsum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bite in front</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bite at the end;</hi> hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to bite</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n37772.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: ni fugissem, medium, credo, praemorsisset, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:9:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 9, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:567" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 567</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">projectos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:5:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 5, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37772.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bite off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">snip off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crib</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et tamen ex hoc, Quodcumque est, Discipuli custos praemordet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:217" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 217</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praemordicus: <entryFree id="n37773" type="main" key="praemordi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praemordĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>praemordeo</etym>, <sense id="n37773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bitten off in front</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at the end</hi> (late Lat.): olera praemordica, <hi rend="ital">of which only the tops are eaten</hi> (e. g. asparagus), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Reg. S. Pachom. 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praemorior: <entryFree id="n37774" type="main" key="praemo^ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-mŏrĭor</orth>, <itype>tuus, 3</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n37774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to die early</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prematurely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to die</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n37774.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut ego praemoriar, primoque exstinguar in aevo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 8, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parte corporis velut praemortua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37774.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to decay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemoritur visus, auditus,</quote> <trans><tr>decays</tr>, <tr>fails</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 50, 51, § 168</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-mortŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">dead.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37774.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacuere, velut praemortua, membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:7:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 7, 65</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37774.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudor praemortuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:72:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 72, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 12:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 12, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praemorsus: <entryFree id="n37775" type="main" key="praemorsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praemorsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praemordeo.</entryFree>
praemortuus: <entryFree id="n37776" type="main" key="praemortu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praemortŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from praemorior.</entryFree>
praemostro: <entryFree id="n37777" type="main" key="praemostro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praemostro</orth>, <itype>old form of praemonstro</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 341</bibl>.</entryFree>
praemotus: <entryFree id="n37778" type="main" key="praemo_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praemōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from praemoveo.</entryFree>
praemoveo: <entryFree id="n37779" type="main" key="praemo^ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-mŏvĕo</orth>, no <sense id="n37779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>mōtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to move beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stir greatly</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 5:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 7</bibl></cit>; 2, 1.</sense></entryFree>
praemundatus: <entryFree id="n37780" type="main" key="praemunda_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-mundātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [mundo], <sense id="n37780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cleansed beforehand</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">praemundatis oculis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praemunio: <entryFree id="n37781" type="main" key="praemu_ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-mūnĭo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">praemoenio</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:27" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2" default="NO">14, 2</bibl>), <itype>īvi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fortify</hi> or <hi rend="ital">defend in front</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n37781.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aditus magnis operibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca necessaria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Isthmum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37781.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37781.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To fortify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">metu venenorum praemuniri medicamentis,</quote> <trans><tr>of securing himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemuniendae regalis potentiae gratiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:6:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus (dicendi) praemunitum, et ex omni parte causae septum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:9:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemunitus scientiā linguarum,</quote> <trans><tr>fortified</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Doct. Chr. 3:1" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Doct. Chr. 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ante praemuniat, of an orator's art,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:40:137" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 40, 137</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n37781.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To place</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">before</hi> another <hi rend="ital">for defence</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strengthening</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae praemuniuntur omnia reliquo sermoni, quo facilius, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>are premised to obviate objections</tr>, <tr>said by way of premunition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:12:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 12, 34</bibl></cit>: illa, quae ex accusatorum oratione praemuniri intellegebam, <hi rend="ital">brought forward</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adduced in defence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 8, 19</bibl>: primum illud praefulci et praemuni, quaeso, ut simus annui, <hi rend="ital">take care of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">secure beforehand</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 13, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praemunitio: <entryFree id="n37782" type="main" key="praemu_ni_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praemūnītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praemunio, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n37782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fortifying</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strengthening beforehand.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37782.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., Ambros. de Isaac et Anim. 4, 37.—</sense><sense id="n37782.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, rhet. t. t., = <foreign lang="greek">pro)</foreign> <pb n="1424" /> <cb n="PRAE" /> <foreign lang="greek">paraskeuh/</foreign>, of an orator, who prepares the minds of his hearers for what he has further to say, <hi rend="ital">a preparation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">premunition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine ullā praemunitione orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:75:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 75, 304</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 53, 204</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praenarro: <entryFree id="n37783" type="hapax" key="praenarro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-narro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tell</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relate beforehand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 5, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praenato: <entryFree id="n37784" type="main" key="praena^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-năto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <sense id="n37784.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To swim before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in front</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praenatans musculus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 62, 88, § 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praenatante pisciculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 45, 68, § 146</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37784.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To swim</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flow by</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domos praenatat amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:705" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 705</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praenavigatio: <entryFree id="n37785" type="main" key="praena_vi^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praenāvĭgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praenavigo</etym>, <sense id="n37785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sailing by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">past</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">praenavigatio Atlantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 31, 36, § 199</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 12, 19, § 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praenavigo: <entryFree id="n37786" type="main" key="praena_vi^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-nāvĭgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n37786.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sail by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">past</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">to sail along</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n37786.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praenavigantes adulterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 51:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 51, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 26, § 97</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praenavigans litus, loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:8:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 8, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppida praenavigari tradunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 146</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37786.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to sail past</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hurry past</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">praenavigamus vitam,</quote> <trans><tr>pass</tr>, <tr>spend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 70:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 70, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeneste: <entryFree id="n37787" type="main" key="Praeneste"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Praeneste</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*prai/nestos</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*prai/neste</foreign>, <sense id="n37787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the most ancient and important cities of Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famed for the beauty of its roses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for its nuts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and still more for its temple of Fortune and the oracle connected with it</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Palestrina; abl.</hi>, Praeneste, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Praeneste sub ipsā (sc. urbe),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:561" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 561</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altum Praeneste,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 682</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:4:15" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 4, 15</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n37787.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Praenestīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Prœneste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Prœnestine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <trans><tr>the town of Prœneste</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:678" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 678</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Praenestinae moenia sacra Deae, i. e. Fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:62" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sortes,</quote> <trans><tr>the oracles of Prœneste</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:41:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 41, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rosae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 4, 10, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <trans><tr>from Rome to Prœneste</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 3, 25, § 42</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Prae-nestīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Prœneste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Prœnestines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 3, 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 1, 8</bibl> Brix ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:21 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 21 sq.</bibl>; v. Ritschl, Opusc. 2, 372.</sense></entryFree>
praenexus: <entryFree id="n37788" type="main" key="praenexus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-nexus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [necto], <sense id="n37788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tied</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bound up in front</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">praenexo obsignatoque ore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
