praenimis: <entryFree id="n37789" type="main" key="praeni^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-nĭmis</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n37789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">too much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quite too</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">praenimis plebeium est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:10:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 10, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeniteo: <entryFree id="n37790" type="main" key="praeni^te^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-nĭtĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n37790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shine</hi> or <hi rend="ital">glitter forth</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n37790.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes praenitent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 162, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna subito praenitens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 9, 6, § 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis veste niveā praenitens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 261, 21</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur tibi junior praeniteat,</quote> <trans><tr>appear more attractive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 33, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unius facies praenitet omnibus,</quote> <trans><tr>shines brighter than they all</tr>, <tr>outshines them all</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 93" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 93</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37790.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes, quarum titulis forum Augusti praenitet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:39:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 39, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus Catonis conspicua atque praenitens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:35:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 35, 1</bibl></cit> (2, 59, 1 dub.).</sense></entryFree>
praenobilis: <entryFree id="n37791" type="main" key="praeno_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-nōbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very famous</hi> or <hi rend="ital">celebrated</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">praenobilis potio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 251, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 700</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praenobilior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 3, p. 355</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praenomen: <entryFree id="n37792" type="main" key="praeno_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-nōmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n37792.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the name which stood before the name of the</hi> gens, <hi rend="ital">the first name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prœnomen</hi>, usually abbreviated; <cit><quote lang="la">thus, in M. Tullius Cicero, Marcus is the prænomen, as A. = Aulus, C. = Caius, Cn. = Cnaeus, etc.: Quintilius cum filio, cui Marco praenomen erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 18, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod sine praenomine familiariter ad me epistulam misisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 32, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quinte, puta, aut Publi (gaudent praenomine molles Auriculae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praenominibus feminas esse appellatas testimonio sunt Caecilia et Tarracia, quae ambae Gaiae solitae sint appellari, pari modo Lucia et Titia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=224" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 224</bibl></cit> Müll.: pueris non prius, quam togam virilem sumerent, puellis non antequam nuberent, praenomina imponi moris fuisse, Q. Scaev. ap. Auct. Epit. Nom. Rat., Huschke, Jurisp. ante-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:page=16 sq" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> p. 16 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n37792.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">an appellation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">title placed before a person's name</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praenomen Imperatoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praenomino: <entryFree id="n37793" type="main" key="praeno_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praenōmĭno</orth>, no <sense id="n37793.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>praenomen</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to give</hi> one <hi rend="ital">the prœnomen</hi> <cb n="PRAE" /> or <hi rend="ital">title of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to name</hi> (very rare): Numerios praenominabant, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 352, 29</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n37793.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To name in the first place</hi> (late Lat.): praenominatur caro, et postea deitas, Rustic. c. Aceph. p. 1236.</sense></entryFree>
praenosco: <entryFree id="n37794" type="main" key="praenosco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-nosco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to learn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">become acquainted with beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to foreknow</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">futura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:38:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 38, 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 24, 56, § 206</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">promissum sibi caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:159" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venturum caeli laborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:490" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 490</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum fata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:7" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 124</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:15:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 15, 13</bibl> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 46</bibl>, the correct reading is: in pretio sumus, acc. to Fleck. and Ussing).</sense></entryFree>
praenotio: <entryFree id="n37795" type="hapax" key="praeno_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praenōtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praenosco</etym>, <sense id="n37795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a previous notion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preconception</hi>, a translation of the Epicurean <foreign lang="greek">pro/lhyis</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive anticipatio sive praenotio deorum,</quote> <trans><tr>innate idea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:17:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 17, 44</bibl></cit>: earum rerum, Boëth. Consol. Phil. 5, pros. 4, p. 106, 31.</sense></entryFree>
praenoto: <entryFree id="n37796" type="main" key="praeno^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-nŏto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (postclass.). <sense id="n37796.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To mark</hi> or <hi rend="ital">note before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in front</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">profert quosdam libros litteris ignorabilibus praenotatos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 268, 11</bibl></cit>: aureo anulo, to <hi rend="ital">seal</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl>, p. 243, 3: psalmum inscriptione, Hilar. in Psa. 15, 1.— </sense><sense id="n37796.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To entitle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">name</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut de deo Socratis praenotaret librum, Aug. Civ. Dei, 8, 14: librum nomine Pamphili martyris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 133</bibl></cit>, n. 3: <cit><quote lang="la">liber hoc titulo praenotatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Retract. 2:14" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Retract. 2, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37796.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To note</hi> or <hi rend="ital">designate beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to predict</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prophetae duos adventus Christi praenotarunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 14</bibl></cit>: crux praenotata, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 629.— </sense><sense id="n37796.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To note down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">write down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabellam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 183, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praenubilus: <entryFree id="n37797" type="main" key="praenu_bi^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-nūbĭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37797.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very cloudy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very dark</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gloomy</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">densā praenubilus arbore lucus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 13, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praenum: <entryFree id="n37798" type="main" key="praenum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praenum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n37798.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an implement for combing flax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hatchel</hi>, Gloss. Philox. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n37798.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an instrument of torture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rack</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tentare praenum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praenunci: <entryFree id="n37799" type="main" key="praenunci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praenunci-</orth>, v. praenunti-.</entryFree>
praenuncupatus: <entryFree id="n37800" type="main" key="praenuncu^pa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-nuncŭpātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [nuncupo], <sense id="n37800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">named beforehand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Emmanuel prophetico ore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 7, 179</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praenuntia: <entryFree id="n37801" type="main" key="praenunti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praenuntĭa</orth>, v. praenuntius.</entryFree>
praenuntiatio: <entryFree id="n37802" type="main" key="praenunti^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praenuntĭātĭo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">praenuncĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praenuntio</etym>, <sense id="n37802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prediction</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
praenuntiativus: <entryFree id="n37803" type="spur" key="praenunti^a_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praenuntĭātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, a false read. for praenuntios, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 71, 73, § 181</bibl>.</entryFree>
praenuntiator: <entryFree id="n37804" type="main" key="praenunti^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praenuntĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>praenuntio</etym>, <sense id="n37804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who announces beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a foreteller</hi>, <hi rend="ital">predicter</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 9:5" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Genes. 8:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Genes. 8, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
praenuntiatrix: <entryFree id="n37805" type="main" key="praenunti^a_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praenuntĭātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praenuntiator</etym>, <sense id="n37805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that foretells</hi> or <hi rend="ital">predicts</hi> (eccl. Lat.): gloriae, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 2, 29.</sense></entryFree>
praenuntio: <entryFree id="n37806" type="main" key="praenunti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-nuntĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">praenunc-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to announce</hi> or <hi rend="ital">publish beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to foretell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foreshow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">predict;</hi> constr. with <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, or an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n37806.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">futura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:6:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 6, 12</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de eorum adventu esse pronuntiatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 9, 4</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 2, 12</bibl>, the correct reading is abi prae: nuntia, etc., Fleck.).—</sense><sense id="n37806.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">juglans, frangi se, praenuntiat strepitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 42, 81, § 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa diras tempestates praenuntiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 35, 90, § 365</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usus turris ad praenuntianda vada,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 12, 18, § 83</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praenuntius: <entryFree id="n37807" type="main" key="praenunti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-nuntĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">praenunc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that foretells</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forebodes.—Subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37807.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">praenuntĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a foreteller</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harbinger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foreboder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an indication</hi>, <hi rend="ital">token</hi>, <hi rend="ital">omen</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Zephyrus Veris praenuntius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:737" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 737</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucis praenuntius ales,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the cock</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:767" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 767</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37807.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">praenuntĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli praenuntia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:207" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 207</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellae magnarum calamitatum praenuntiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:5:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inquisitio candidati, praenuntia repulsae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:21:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 21, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thraseam prohibitum immoto animo praenuntiam imminentis caedis contumeliam excepisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37807.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">praenuntĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a harbinger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">token</hi>, <hi rend="ital">omen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">futuri eventus alicujus id praenuntium est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 84, 86, § 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istarum procellarum quaedam sunt praenuntia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:10:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <trans><tr>beaconlights</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 71, 73, § 181</bibl></cit>; v. Sillig <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> ad h. l. <cb n="PRAE" /></sense></entryFree>
praeobturans: <entryFree id="n37808" type="hapax" key="praeobtu_rans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-obtūrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [obturo], <sense id="n37808.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stopping up in front</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 12, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeoccido: <entryFree id="n37809" type="main" key="praeocci^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-occĭdo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n37809.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go down</hi> or <hi rend="ital">set before;</hi> of constellations (post-Aug.); with <case>dat.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 29, 69, § 285</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeoccupatio: <entryFree id="n37810" type="main" key="praeoccu^pa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeoccŭpātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praeoccupo</etym>. <sense id="n37810.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A seizing beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preoccupation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locorum praeoccupatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37810.1" n="II" level="1"> Rhet. fig., <hi rend="ital">an anticipation of what properly comes afterwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prolepsis</hi>, Beda, Schem. et Tropis <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n37810.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A disease that violently distends the abdomen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae passio Graece emphragma, Latine praeoccupatio dicitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeoccupo: <entryFree id="n37811" type="main" key="praeoccu^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-occŭpo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (class., but not in Cic., since praecepit is the true read., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 1, 2</bibl>). <sense id="n37811.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To seize upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take possession of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">occupy beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to preoccupy.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37811.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic ne intrare posset saltum, Datames praeoccupare studuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Macedoniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eum. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca opportuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:28" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:47" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Asiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:69:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 69, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praeoccupatum sese legatione ab Cn. Pompeio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37811.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To take</hi>, <hi rend="ital">catch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seize</hi> in an act: <cit><quote lang="la">si praeoccupatus fuerit homo in delicto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gal. 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37811.3" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos timor praeoccupaverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 41, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hilaritas praeoccupaverat mentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeoccupati beneficio animi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>won over beforehand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:20:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 20, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37811.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To anticipate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne alter alterum praeoccuparet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">obj.clause</hi> (like the simpler occupare): <cit><quote lang="la">legem de multarum aestimatione ipsi praeoccupaverunt ferre,</quote> <trans><tr>hastened to bring the bill sooner before the people</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 30, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeoleo: <entryFree id="n37812" type="main" key="praeo^le^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-ŏlĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n37812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to emit</hi> or <hi rend="ital">exhale an odor beforehand</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut crocus, ita somnus prius quam prope adsit, longe praeolet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 1:4" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 1, 4</bibl></cit> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
praeolo: <entryFree id="n37813" type="hapax" key="praeo^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-ŏlo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n37813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. impers.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to perceive before</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut praeolat mihi quod tu velis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 41</bibl></cit>; v. Ritschl ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
praeopimus: <entryFree id="n37814" type="main" key="praeo^pi_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-ŏpīmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37814.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very fat</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">vitulus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poen. 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeopto: <entryFree id="n37815" type="main" key="praeopto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-opto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to choose</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wish rather</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to desire more</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prefer</hi> (class.; not in Cic.); constr. <hi rend="ital">aliquid alicui</hi>, with an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>, or with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeoptantes exsilio modicam domi fortunam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:30:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 30, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:22:14" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 22, 14</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">suas leges Romanae civitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:45:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 45, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Punicam societatem Romanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:43:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 43, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filiam equitis Romani nuptiis generosarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 12, 1</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo non illos sibi quam vos dominos praeoptet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sterilem platanum quam maritam ulmum praeoptaverim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meum potius caput periculo Praeoptavisse quam is periret ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi praeoptarent scutum manu emittere et nudo corpore pugnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">perire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:4:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:14:1" default="NO">11, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 1</bibl>, ext. 5; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Chron. 1, 32, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut puerum praeoptares perire, Potius quam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 17</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeoptavisti, amorem tuom uti virtuti praeponeres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeordino: <entryFree id="n37816" type="main" key="praeordi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-ordĭno</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37816.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to preordain</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Deus praeordinavit te, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:22:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 22, 14</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praeordĭnā-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, <hi rend="ital">ordered beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preordained</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:4:44" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 4, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:10:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 10, 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeoro: <entryFree id="n37817" type="gloss" key="praeo_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-ōro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pray before</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 106</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeostendo: <entryFree id="n37818" type="main" key="praeostendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praeostendo</orth>, <itype>endi, ensum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to show beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">display before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make clear</hi> (late. Lat.): hoc monstrare debent, hoc ostendere vel praeostendere, Aug. Civ. Dei, 21, 8, 6.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: portenta a portendendo, id est, praeostendendo, Aug. Civ. Dei, 21, 8, 6; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 11, 3, 3</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praeosten-sus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, <hi rend="ital">foreshown</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">sabbatum praeostensum et praedictum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praepalpans: <entryFree id="n37819" type="main" key="praepalpans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-palpans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [palpo], <sense id="n37819.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stroking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">patting before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in front</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praepando: <entryFree id="n37820" type="main" key="praepando"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-pando</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to open</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spread before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to spread out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n37820.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestibula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 24, 28, § 80</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n37820.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: lumina menti alicujus, Lucr. <pb n="1425" /> <cb n="PRAE" /> 1, 144: <cit><quote lang="la">hibernos praepandens temporis ortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=274" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 274</bibl></cit> (40).</sense></entryFree>
praeparatio: <entryFree id="n37821" type="main" key="praepa^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praepărātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praeparo</etym>. <sense id="n37821.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A getting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">making ready</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a preparing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preparation</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">priusquam aggrediare, adhibenda est praeparatio diligens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:21:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 21, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provisio animi et praeparatio ad minuendum dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:14:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 14, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:12:6" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">futurae impensae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 124" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cordis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 9, 17</bibl></cit> (37): pugnae, id. Judith, 4, 4.—</sense><sense id="n37821.1" n="II" level="1"> Rhet., <hi rend="ital">a preparation</hi> of the hearers for what is to follow, = <foreign lang="greek">proparaskeuh/</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 10, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:55" default="NO">4, 2, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:17" default="NO">9, 2, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praeparato: <entryFree id="n37822" type="main" key="praepa^ra_to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praepărātō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. praeparo, <sense id="n37822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
praeparator: <entryFree id="n37823" type="main" key="praepa^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praepărātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>praeparo</etym>, <sense id="n37823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a preparer</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Joannes praeparator viarum Domini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeparatorius: <entryFree id="n37824" type="main" key="praepa^ra_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praepărātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>praeparator</etym>, <sense id="n37824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">preparatory</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">interdictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:29:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 29, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeparatura: <entryFree id="n37825" type="main" key="praepa^ra_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praepărātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praeparo</etym>, <sense id="n37825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a preparing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preparation</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">praeparatura viarum Domini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeparatus: <entryFree id="n37826" type="main" key="praepa^ra_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-părātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from praeparo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n37827" type="main" key="praepa^ra_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-părātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>praeparo</etym>, <sense id="n37827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a preparation</hi> (post - Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">praeparatus Caesaris contra Antonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:76:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 76, 3</bibl></cit> dub. (Haase, apparatus; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:12:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 12, 3</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">rei rusticae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:11:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 11, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeparcus: <entryFree id="n37828" type="main" key="praeparcus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-parcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very sparing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very niggardly</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n37828.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes praeparcae (opp. prodigae atque edaces),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 19, 21, § 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37828.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 24, 51, § 110</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeparo: <entryFree id="n37829" type="main" key="praepa^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-păro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to get</hi> or <hi rend="ital">make ready beforehand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prepare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make preparations for</hi>, etc. (class.; cf.: paro, apparo). </sense><sense id="n37829.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea quae videntur instare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeparaverat ante naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commeatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum in decem annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum domestici belli causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 9</bibl></cit>: se et suos milites ad proelia, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 1, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeparato ad talem casum perfugio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeparatis jam omnibus ad fugam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:47:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 47, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 19, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 17, 1</bibl>; 40, 15, 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeparat se pugnae,</quote> <trans><tr>prepares himself for the combat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 20, 29, § 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum majori operi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:109:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 109, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva frumentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia stipendio militum praeparata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:13:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 13, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profectionem,</quote> <trans><tr>to make preparations for one's departure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necem fratri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res necessarias ad vitam degendam,</quote> <trans><tr>to provide</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibos hiemi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 37, 56, § 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anchusae radix praeparat lanas pretiosis coloribus,</quote> <trans><tr>prepares</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 20, 23, § 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:96" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 11, 58, § 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:107" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 6, 34, § 107</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">potum cantharidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 4, 30, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ova,</quote> <trans><tr>to prepare for eating</tr>, <tr>to cook</tr>, <tr>dress</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:56:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 56, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sibi praeparabat imperium,</quote> <trans><tr>was aiming at</tr>, <tr>aspiring to</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37829.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: animos ad sapientiam concipiendam, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 12, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 5, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam adversus publicum odium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excusationem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aditum nefariae spei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:9:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 9, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:9:13" default="NO">4, 9, 13</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praepărātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">prepared</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provided</hi> with any thing (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">praeparatos quodam cultu atque victu proficisci ad dormiendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:58:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 58, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeparato animo se tradere quieti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 53, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene praeparatum Pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeparatis auribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or 28, 99</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praepărātō</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ex prae-părātō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with preparation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam nihil praeparato, nihil festinato fecisse videtur Milo!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex ante praeparato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non enim ex praeparato locutus est, sed subito deprehensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 11:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 11, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeparvus: <entryFree id="n37830" type="main" key="praeparvus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-parvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very small</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 2, 819</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praepatior: <entryFree id="n37831" type="main" key="praepa^ti^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-pătĭor</orth>, <itype>păti</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n37831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to suffer very much</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:34 al" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 34 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
praepedimentum: <entryFree id="n37832" type="main" key="praepe^di_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praepĕdīmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>praepedio</etym>, <sense id="n37832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hinderance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impediment</hi> (ante-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praepedio: <entryFree id="n37833" type="main" key="praepe^di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praepĕdĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi, ĭi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>praepes</etym>, <sense id="n37833.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to entangle the feet</hi> or <hi rend="ital">other parts of the body; to shackle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fetter</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> <cb n="PRAE" /> and post-Aug.; syn.: impedio, illaqueo, irretio). </sense><sense id="n37833.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">praepeditus latera forti ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praepeditis Numidarum equis,</quote> <trans><tr>tied to the manger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 25</bibl></cit>: sine modo sese praedā praepediant, <hi rend="ital">let them hamper</hi> or <hi rend="ital">embarrass themselves</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:38:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 38, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37833.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obstruct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impede</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">singultu medios praepediente sonos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:42" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timor praepedit dicta linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si forte aliquos flumina, nives, venti praepedissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:68" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:478" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 478</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugam hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0116,001:Pan. Theodos. 40" default="NO"><author>Pac.</author> Pan. Theodos. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recitantium praecipua pronuntiationis adjumenta, oculi, manus, praepediuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praepediri valetudine,</quote> <trans><tr>to be prevented by illness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praepeditus morbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 7, 21</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiamsi praepeditus sit perculsas tot victoriis Germanias servitio premere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 73</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praependeo: <entryFree id="n37834" type="main" key="praepende^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-pendĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n37834.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hang before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hang down in front</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi tegumenta praependere possent ad defendendos ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">storias circum turrim praependentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praependent demissae in pocula sertae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:33" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 33</bibl></cit> (3, 31), 37: <cit><quote lang="la">barba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:48:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 48, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ancones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacinia praependens impedit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 286, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praepes: <entryFree id="n37835" type="main" key="praepe^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praepĕs</orth>, <itype>ĕtis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>prae-peto</etym>. <sense id="n37835.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37835.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Flying swiftly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swift of flight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nimble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fleet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapid</hi>, etc. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; syn.: velox, pernix, levis): praepes Laeva volavit avis, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:48:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 48, 108</bibl> (Ann. v. 94 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">praepetibus pinnis ausus se credere caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Boreas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:578" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 578</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7</bibl></cit>, prooem. 1, § 4: ferrum, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 3</bibl> (Ann. 437 Vahl.): Victoria, Cn. Matius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praepeti evolare cursu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1061" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 1061</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 146, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notarum praepetum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 146, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praepetes aves quidam dici aiunt, quia secundum auspicium faciant praetervolantes, alii quod aut ea, quae praepetamus, indicent, aut quod praetervolant: alii ex Graeco tractum putant, quod ante conspectum volent nostrum. Ceterum poëtae promiscue omnes aves ita appellant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=205" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 205</bibl></cit> Müll. —</sense><sense id="n37835.2" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">winged</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem praepes ab Ida Sublimem pedibus rapuit Jovis armiger uncis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 254</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela praepetis dei, i. e. Cupidinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 8, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37835.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">praepĕs</orth>, ĕtis. </sense><sense id="n37835.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bird</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:617" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 617</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovis, i. e. aquila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:713" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 713</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">14, 576: quae (columba), super ingenti circumdata praepetis umbrā, i. e. accipitris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:32" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37835.5" n="b" level="4"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a prophetic bird</hi>, from whose flight something favorable was predicted (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">oscines, alites): praepetis omina pinnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 361</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 26</bibl>: hanc ubi praepetibus pinnis lapsuque volantem Conspexit Marius augur, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:47:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 47, 106</bibl>: (praepetes sunt, quae secundo auspicio ante eum volant, qui auspicatur. Praepetes aut superiora tenent, et praepetes vocantur; aut inferiora, et dicuntur inferae. Praepetes autem ideo, quia omnes aves priora petunt volantes: vel a Graeco <foreign lang="greek">pe/tomai</foreign>, id est volo, Serv.; cf. supra the passage from Fest.). —</sense><sense id="n37835.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Medusaeus,</quote> <trans><tr>Pegasus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 257</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37835.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>, of <hi rend="ital">Perseus</hi> himself, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:662" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 662</bibl> and 688.—</sense><sense id="n37835.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">lucky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propitious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortunate</hi> (ante-class.): pulchrique loci, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:6:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 6, 9</bibl> (Ann. v. 97 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">portus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:6:9:section=6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 6, 9, § 6</bibl></cit> (Ann. v. 478 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
praepeto: <entryFree id="n37836" type="hapax" key="praepe^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-pĕto</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strive diligently after</hi>, Fest. s. v. praepetes, p. 245 Müll. (v. praepes, A. 1).</sense></entryFree>
praepigneratus: <entryFree id="n37837" type="main" key="praepigne^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-pignĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [pignero], <sense id="n37837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pledged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obliged</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
praepilatus: <entryFree id="n37838" type="main" key="praepi^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-pĭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [2. pila], <sense id="n37838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished in front</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">tipped with a ball</hi> or <hi rend="ital">button</hi> (not before the Aug. per.). </sense><sense id="n37838.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: pila praepilata, Auct. B. Afr. 72: missilia, <hi rend="ital">darts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">javelins with a blunt point rounded like a ball</hi>, that they might not inflict wounds, something like our foils, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:51:section=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 51, § 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 6, 6, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 30, 50, § 95</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37838.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">declamationes, quibus ad pugnam forensem, velut praepilatis, exerceri solebamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praepilo: <entryFree id="n37839" type="main" key="praepi^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praepĭlo</orth>, no <sense id="n37839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>praepilum</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to point in front</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at the end like a</hi> pilum (post-class.): praepilatis missilibus <cb n="PRAE" /> principiis pugnae tentatis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 6, 10</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n37839.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To throw forwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurl before</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">praepilabantur missilia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 12, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praepinguis: <entryFree id="n37840" type="main" key="praepinguis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-pinguis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n37840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very fat</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n37840.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 51, 77, § 207</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>very rich</tr>, <tr>very fertile</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:698" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 698</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 17, 45, § 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod praepinguis fuerit visus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37840.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox praepinguis,</quote> <trans><tr>too thick</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praeplecto: <entryFree id="n37841" type="gloss" key="praeplecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-plecto</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37841.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strike before</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 107</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeplexus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 107</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praepollentia: <entryFree id="n37842" type="main" key="praepollenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praepollentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>prae-polleo</etym>, <sense id="n37842.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">excellence</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 70" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 70</bibl>, Serm. 1, 15.</sense></entryFree>
praepolleo: <entryFree id="n37843" type="main" key="praepolle^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-pollĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n37843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to exceed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">surpass in power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be very powerful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be very remarkable</hi> or <hi rend="ital">distinguished</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quibus additis praepollebat,</quote> <trans><tr>he had the superiority</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoenices mari praepollebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puella praepollet pulcritudine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 182, 29</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praepollens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">very powerful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very distinguished</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens divitiis praepollens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir, virtute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 34</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: vis oculorum praepollentior, Aug. Civ. Dei, 22, 29.‡ * <orth extent="full" lang="la">praepondĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praepondero</etym>, <hi rend="ital">preponderance</hi>: praeponderatio, <foreign lang="greek">r(oph/</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.</sense></entryFree>
praepondero: <entryFree id="n37844" type="main" key="praeponde^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-pondĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n37844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37844.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be of greater weight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to preponderate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incline</hi> (post-Aug.; cf. propendeo). </sense><sense id="n37844.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne, portionum aequitate turbatā, mundus praeponderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:10:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quotiens in alterum latus praeponderans declinarat sarcina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37844.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37844.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be of more weight</hi> or <hi rend="ital">influence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have the preference</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquis reum me defendit, sed uxorem meam violavit ... in comparatione beneficii praeponderavit injuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:4:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis injuriae praeponderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 81:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 81, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestas praeponderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3:25" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:615" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 615</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37844.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To turn the scale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give a decision</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incline</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in humaniorem partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si neutro litis condicio praeponderet,</quote> <trans><tr>decides neither one way nor the other</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo praeponderet alea fati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:603" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 603</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n37844.6" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">to show preference</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to act with partiality</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter duos liberos pari desperatione languentes, da bonum patrem, non praeponderabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 8:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 8, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">neutrum, si in neutram partem praeponderet,</quote> <trans><tr>inclines</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10:section=5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10, § 5</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n37844.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to outweigh</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui omnia metiuntur emolumentis et commodis, neque ea volunt praeponderari honestate,</quote> <trans><tr>to be surpassed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:4:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 4, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
praepono: <entryFree id="n37845" type="main" key="praepo_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-pōno</orth>, <itype>pŏsui, pŏsĭtum, 3</itype> (old <sense id="n37845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> praeposivi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 11</bibl>.—Sync. form praepostus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:999" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 999</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">set before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to place first</hi> (syn.: praefero, praeficio). </sense><sense id="n37845.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n37845.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">versus, in primā fronte libelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:7:33" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 7, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeponens ultima primis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oportet, ut aedibus ac templis vestibula et aditus, sic causis principia proportione rerum praeponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:79:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 79, 320</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de quā priusquam respondeo, pauca praeponam,</quote> <trans><tr>I will first make a few observations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 27, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37845.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to place</hi> or <hi rend="ital">set over as chief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commander</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">superintendent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to place at the head of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intrust with the charge</hi> or <hi rend="ital">command of; to appoint</hi> or <hi rend="ital">depute as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum illum ex omnibus delegistis, quem bello praedonum praeponeretis,</quote> <trans><tr>to appoint commander in the war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:22:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 22, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hibernis Labienum praeposuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinistro cornu Antonium praeposuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem provinciae,</quote> <trans><tr>to appoint as governor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotio,</quote> <trans><tr>to charge with the management of an affair</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to appoint admiral</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:38:section=101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 38, § 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigalibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to appoint minister of finance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bibulus toti officio maritimo praepositus,</quote> <trans><tr>superintendent of all maritime affairs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praepositus cubiculo,</quote> <trans><tr>chamberlain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdos oraculo praeposita,</quote> <trans><tr>that presides over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:34:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 34, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem custodem alicui loco,</quote> <trans><tr>to appoint keeper of a place</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:1:67" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 1, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum exercitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:92" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 92</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n37845.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To place</hi> or <hi rend="ital">set upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fronti praeponere olivam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 7</bibl></cit> (cf.: <pb n="1426" /> <cb n="PRAE" /> comis praetexere frondes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 70" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 70</bibl>).— </sense><sense id="n37845.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to set before</hi> or <hi rend="ital">above</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prefer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucrum praeposivi sopori et quieti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se alteri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutem rei publicae vitae suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiam patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessaria gloriosis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:110:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 110, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum mihi praestat, si me Mazaeo generum praeponit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:11:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 11, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Prochytam Suburrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:5" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praepŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n37845.6" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">praepŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a prefect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">president</hi>, <hi rend="ital">head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overseer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">director</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commander</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatorum tuorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 36, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod (milites) praepositos suos occiderant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 1</bibl></cit>: rerum curae Caesaris, <hi rend="ital">director</hi>, S. C. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 6, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum,</quote> <trans><tr>water-inspector</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 17" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:100" default="NO">100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:117" default="NO">117</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubiculi,</quote> <trans><tr>a chamberlain</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 10, 5</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the governor of a province;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Illyrico, Dalmatiae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:112:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 112, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:116:2" default="NO">2, 116, 2</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:1 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 1 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 7, 10</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n37845.7" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">praepŏsĭta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (eccl. Lat.), <hi rend="ital">a prioress</hi> or <hi rend="ital">abbess</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 21, 8; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 211</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37845.8" n="C" level="2"> With the Stoics, <orth extent="full" lang="la">praepŏsĭta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, for the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">prohgme/na</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">preferable</hi> or <hi rend="ital">advantageous things</hi>, but which are not to be called absolutely good; such as wealth, beauty, etc. (class.): ista bona non dico, sed dicam Graece <foreign lang="greek">prohgme/na</foreign>, Latine autem producta: <cit><quote lang="la">sed praeposita, aut praecipua malo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:26:72 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 26, 72 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonum negas esse divitias, praepositum esse dicis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 26, 73</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 16, 52</bibl></cit>; 54.</sense></entryFree>
praeporto: <entryFree id="n37846" type="main" key="praeporto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">prae-porto</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n37846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carry before</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:621" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 621</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 193</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prae se Scorpius infestus praeportans flebile acumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=430" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 430</bibl></cit> (682).</sense></entryFree>
praeposita: <entryFree id="n37847" type="main" key="praepo^si^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praepŏsĭta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. praepono, II. C.</entryFree>
praepositio: <entryFree id="n37848" type="main" key="praepo^si^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">praepŏsĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>praepono</etym>. <sense id="n37848.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A putting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">setting before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a preferring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preference</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:16:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 16, 54</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n37848.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A placing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">setting over as commander</hi> or <hi rend="ital">president</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an appointing to command</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem navi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:1:1:section=12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 1, 1, § 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n37848.2" n="III" level="1"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">a preposition</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:47:158" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 47, 158</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praeposito in privatur verbum eā vi, quam haberet, si in praepositum non fuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:chapter=11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum praepositione dicitur volgo ornamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=76" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 76</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 13</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
